Reviews.Title: “Reasonable accommodation at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: colrutter
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice in the past month and I found the standard to be quite reasonable. It is no a 5 star accommodation but it is comfortable and clean. I stayed on two different floors and did not have the same experience that other reviewers have reported. The second time I was fortunate to get a room on the 12th floor with a view of the Hollywood sign. The hotel location has the advantage of being opposite a Metro station (Wilshire/Normandie) which is on the purple line and with only one change you can be in the Hollywood area in a reasonable time. The front desk staff were very pleasant , two of the staff namely Cade and Brendon were very helpful and as I arrived on an early flight from Australia they made every effort to ensure that I had a check-in before the usual 3pm. I would certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The website is very misleading.”
Reviews.Author: zyfzkO
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel under a friends recommendation, but after reading one of the reviews after our stay, I think he might have recommended The Hotel Whilshire. If you take public transport, ie train, you will need to change three lines and take about one hour to get there from LAX airport. Don't do it if your plane arrives late at night and if it is your first time in LA. We took the train and bus option, and due to a delayed flight, we arrived at LAX at night. the trip planner I have prepared instructed us to change to a local bus at Vermont train station. Well, shall I say -It was the dirties, most offputting train station I have ever been to. there is no light in the lift and you could smell urine. I didn't feel save at all. Desperate to get onto a bus, at least there will be lights and a nus driver, we boarded the local bus 206, it took us along Normandie road, there were only two female passengers boarded the bus throughout our ride, and that was the only time I felt saver. The hotel is in the middle of the korean town, if you are comfortable to explore the suburb at night, you will find some decent korean restaurants and supermarket, some restaurants open for 24 hours. Now, the hotel. When I heard the good review from a frequent traveller friend of mine, I went onto their website and checke out the rate. It is about 130 aussie a night. With the glamorous photos and intro they had on their website, I thought, I have just found a gem in LA to stay. Well, not so soon..... When I got to the hotel, I thougt the lobby on their website seems grander. I thought I went to the wrong hotel until the front desk assured me that they can find my booking. The room we stayed in is on the 11th floor, the lift took us up is quite old. We can definately smell cigarette odour in our room even though it states as a non smoking room. We can see hollywood sign from our window, that was a small excitment. The furniture are out dated, but the room is clean. Only complain is the aircon. The is very noisy when you turn it on. WiFi is free but super slow in the room, guests go to the lobby to use the faster free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Down at the heels”
Reviews.Author: trails2u
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very run-down and shabby. The room was clean, except for old smoking smell and stained carpet. Also, the rooms look nothing like the photos on the website. The furnishings are very old and faded. The hallways smelled like urine. The bottled water from the gift shop was a used, refilled bottle. Buy water from the machines. The restaurant was closed before 10 p.m., even though it's hours are posted til 10:30 p.m. The parking is ridiculously expensive, but the valet's are the only friendly, courteous staff in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a facelift in many ways”
Reviews.Author: jfperkins
Reviews.Content: This hotel's best days (or years) are way behind it. I travel for both business and pleasure a bunch each year. I probably spend 75-100 nights a year in hotels. In my opinion, this was one of the worst hotel experiences I have had in several years. The rooms are filthy and severely outdated. The carpet is coming up all over the room. The curtains are heavy, dank, musty and filthy. The housekeeping was basic at best. The towels in the bathroom are barely larger than hand towels and are wafer thin - as are the walls. A upgrade/refresh would be nice. The lobby has been refreshed, now it is time to tackle the rooms.The hotel is in a great location between downtown and West Hollywood, so why not? The staff were, for the most part, pleasant. The valet guys are a bit pushy but they probably earn most of their income on tips, wait, then maybe they could be less pushy and nicer? Oh yeah, the "Hollywood sign" view is not exactly that. It is a view of a high-rise apartment and if you look closely, off in the distance you can see the sign. Don't spend the extra $10-15 a night for this like I foolishly did. Unfortunately, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent Booked Wrong Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: cassie-gross
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked us into the wrong hotel which can easily be done as the one we wanted is call THE HOTEL WILSHIRE and this is THE WILSHIRE HOTEL. It didn't bother me because it was only a stop over for us. Make sure your in the right hotel as it is quite a difference. Luckily we were only staying over night as a last stop before heading home. The rooms are Extremely dated although clean. There isn't much around by the look of it. We had Mcdonalds for dinner and there were homeless people and drunks everywhere. Don't venture out at night if you can help it. The staff were amazingly friendly and offered us a late check out for free which was great. The Wifi worked although dropped out in the morning we were due to check out. It is about a $50-$60 cab fare from LAX so order a shuttle if you can. This hotel just needs a facelift and it would be an OK place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “You can easily do better”
Reviews.Author: Faja1984
Reviews.Content: This hotel at first glance from it's website and ground floor appears to be a very good choice. However, once you get onto 3rd floors and higher, it's very apparent that the upkeep of hotel has been very poor. The first room I stayed at had the following problems: -AC unit was blowing out cigarette odor despite being a non-smoking room -Tile in bathroom was cracked and degrading -Carpet in room was stained in several areas -Free wi-fi was extremely slow -TV was an CRT unit that had very poor picture quality and limited channel selection. -Considerable street noise. After being requested to be relocated to a second room, the following problems were noticed: -AC unit was not blowing out cigarette odor BUT it was not able to cool the room either. -Tile in bathroom floor was stilling broken in several areas. -Carpet in the room was still stained in several areas with about six 6" black stains. -Free wi-fi was again very slow...wasn't sure if Google would even load. -TV was again an old CRT unit with same issues. -Considerable street noise. In addition to this, the gym offered on the 11th floor was practically falling apart and was not opened at its posted time. The 5-7PM happy hour selection (both free food and half price menu selection) was very limited. It is right next to a metro stop but being located in LA, there are plenty of metro rail and bus stops all over the city and most only being 5-10 minutes walk away. Had they offered other incentives, such as 3 pieces of free laundry, complementary dinners and/or drinks, or other incentives...this would have made them more competitive against other hotels and motels. So the take-away from this is: Only use this hotel when you can't find any other hotels or even motels to stay at, which should be very tough situation to get into. If I had a chance to do this again, I would have chosen a hotel with loyalty programs like Hilton or Holiday Inn chains.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad!”
Reviews.Author: AlfSue
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Feb 28, 2012 to March 2, 2012 for business and found it to be ok. The rooms are dated but clean. We were told that this Hotel has been sold and that the new owners will be doing renovations. Had a problem with the sink in the bathroom and when it was brought to the attention at the front desk it was handled immediately. Friendly staff, knowledgeable and willing to help. The subway is located across the street which was really convenient for us. Their is Limo Service service located at the front lobby and the Head Bell Boy even got us a rental car for a great price. The Hotel is located about 20 mins from The Walk of Fame, The Kodak Theater and Downtown La (La Live). Overall we found it to be a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed”
Reviews.Author: imnottan
Reviews.Content: Seen roach motels with nicer amenities. Rooms are deplorable, staff at valet is.horendous, rude, and parking is expensive. Front desk staff is the worst ive ever encountered. Management is discourteous and rude. Food isn't good quality either. Would rather just sleep in my car next time. Good luck getting your free wi fi to work

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service - ok location if you like to use the subway”
Reviews.Author: LouLou09000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my first time visiting LA. The hotel is located in a quite area with not a whole lot of pubs , restaurants around. Area in generally is a quite run down area, with a lot of unpleasant people wondering the streets - not safe walking the area at dark. It's near to the underground subway which was good to get around to places, but be warned people - if you are white and look like a tourist you will get starred at and feel unsafe and unsecured on these subways. Taxis are an option but can be quite pricy to get to local tourist attractions. Staff at the desk where really unhelpful and rude. Water in our room was cold, there was no safe and very little space , rooms could also do with a bit of refurb . 6/10

Reviews.Title: “Excellent human relations!”
Reviews.Author: Tania1974
Reviews.Content: I would like to say how appreciative I am to the gracious hospitality of the manager Tiffany, and her staff. Also, my gratitude to the privacy housekeeping gave us, while still replenishing us our daily amenities. As for the security and the valet service, they went above and beyond their duty protecting us and taking excellent care of our car. Thank you so much for all of the above! Sincerely, Tania Lamarre- prior guest, room 528.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: chefry
Reviews.Content: this was the third leg of our trip, and we were surprised at the quality of this hotel!!! check in was helpful and friendly!! location was close to the metro!! which was easy to use and so clean!!! for an underground!!!! the lobby bar was inexpensive for a hotel, and the bar staff again were very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and utterly surprising stay thanks to agent Tom!”
Reviews.Author: HY K
Reviews.Content: My bf had booked a one night stay earlier in the day for a Saturday night. We just wanted somewhere clean and decent to stay, and the rates for the Wilshire Hotel were equivalent to several other subpar, 2-3 star accommodations. When we arrived at the front desk we were greeted by Tom. There seemed to be a busy hustle of flight attendants, wedding reception goers, and tourists in the lobby. Tom notified us that no more single King beds were available (only double beds) due to the business of the night, despite our reservation for a single King. At first I thought no biggie, but gently prodded with a smile for any complimentary perks. He replied pleasantly that not much was really available and ended up giving us keys to a room. He said if we didn't approve to call down and he'd arrange otherwise. MUCH TO OUR FLABBERGASTED AND FULLY STOKED SURPRISE, these magical keys were keys to the presidential suite replete with dos bathrooms, living room, dining area, KING bed, and even a little letter writing nook. He called up and asked if we would be okay with the room, lol. MANY THANKS TOM! Excellent customer service and willingness to go above and beyond. The suite's accommodations weren't all modern and fancy pants, but shoot, the wall to wall floor to ceiling view and presidential-ness of the suite was just awesome with awesome sauce on top.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine service”
Reviews.Author: chicagobeenz
Reviews.Content: I travel all across the U.S. for business and stay in many different hotels. It's not always about the brand, it's about the quality; and it's not always about the price you pay, but it's about the service - and this place delivers the type of service a traveler looks for in a hotel. I was traveling for business, and the staff were all so friendly and accommodating. Especially, Ms. Tiffany, one of the managers. She always had a smile on her face and made me feel welcomed. She suggested a couple good sushi places in the area and recommended a few places to visit while I was in town. The staff here are eager and willing to help and make you feel real right at home while staying there. Thank you for a great stay - I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Average at best Depending....”
Reviews.Author: machete
Reviews.Content: If you basically only use the room only to sleep I'd give this place an "average" rating at best. If you spend a few awake hours per day in the room as I did, then I would not stay here. I observed all of the following: Carpet and ottoman was very worn and had some pretty big, dark stains in many places. There was NO CABLE TV, only a few basic channels on an old Zenith TV....No CNBC no business network, not much of anything! The bathroom faucet leaked, and in the sink and shower the water would get only warm, not hot. It was difficult to adjust the room temperature as there was no ac / heat choice. It had only on or off, and hi / low, and put out slight heat in the AM hours and cool air in the pm hours, not able to adjust. The bath towels were ridiculously small, barely bigger than hand towels, and thin material. The bathroom was tiny and very cramped. There was no telephone book for yellow page browsing, and I could not call the front desk because the phone menu paper was missing from the face of the phone which had several buttons, but did not know which one was which due to missing face. The full ceiling to floor windows afforded a nice view, but because that side was all window it was very loud with outside noise. I could hear a toddler throwing a fit outdoors on the sidewalk below from my room 10 floors high, not to mention traffic noise, constant honking, airplanes, and sirens. The person I was with who had a separate room, and upon his check-in, he found the room still occupied with others' property, and it had not been cleaned. He had to get a different room. (Note: Since the TV checkout would not work I checked out at the desk and the person next to me who just checked in had the same complaint). The desk lady was very rude to her as well. To top it all off on checkout day the buffet breakfast cost $23 dollars for one. It was an okay breakfast, but I've had much better breakfast buffets that were complimentary at Best Westerns. AND the internet in the business center of the hotel was 49 cents per minute for crying out loud. I've stayed at many Best Westerns and other two and three star places where it's free. The room was clean and the security seemed to be right on top of things when it came to people entering and exiting the front doors and the elevators, and the location was convenient if you need to stay in the area of Korea Town for business etc, but just be aware if you have to hang out in the facility, you can expect the above mentioned concerns.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: sara s
Reviews.Content: perfect location and price for the LA fashion district. front desk help was so-so, but the hotel and cleanliness and amenities were great.

Reviews.Title: “spartan rooms that does the job”
Reviews.Author: pris4
Reviews.Content: Lobby is welcoming and posh looking , but rooms are a far cry from the lobby and what you see advertised in their website. But, nonetheless, the spartan rooms does the job if you are only looking for a place to stay. Location is fantastic with the metro right across the street and numerous bustops right outside the hotel. Bus 720 takes you to santa monica beach and rodeo drive.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad.”
Reviews.Author: LovelyJess
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wilshire last month and I have got to say some rooms are terrible! When I checked in they gave me a room on floor number 3, it was probably the worst room I've ever seen. I called the reception desk and luckily Susie was able to change my room. She was very nice and friendly, she even sent someone up with the new room number and keys so I didnt have to go back downstairs. The second room I got was on floor number 11 and so much better! Over all I think this hotel was not so bad for what I paid. And what really helps is that the reception desk is willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: passportravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel relies on name for business. Lobby is nice but check in receptionist was indifferent to serving me and when I asked for an upgrade he was incredulous. The room was worse. It is so 80's and is in dire need of it's own upgrade. Tv was still of old cathode with cheap motel chain channels,and the mattress too was a cheap motel type. The thermostat control is like it was repaired by an unqualified maintenance person. Bathroom amenties are old and furniture is tired. My reservation was for 3 nights but I checked out the next morning and spent 20 bucks more for a certain fabulous boutique hotel further west on Wilshire near the 405. The difference was night and day.

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a book by it's cover!”
Reviews.Author: Marciamc
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks fabulous. Beautifully decorated. Great concierge. Clean. Great coffee bar and restaurant. Excellent food. Lovely breakfast included. But - once you get to your room!!! We had quite a few rooms by the way. Ill fitting sheets (nearly all rooms), uncontrollable thermostat (2 rooms), hot water that runs out (a couple of rooms), two towels for three people (all rooms), blocked toilet (three rooms), broken phone (our room) and a full range of desk staff from rude to extremely helpful. Booking was incorrect on first night, and we had to juggle, which meant we didn't use a room - but we still had to pay for it. The lifts are sloooowwww.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay but good value”
Reviews.Author: euexplorer
Reviews.Content: Quite a nice layout to the hotel. Rooms were very nice. Comfortable clean and spacious. Slept very well while here. Hotel is quite big and had a bit of a job trying to find the restauraunt. I was kind of sorry I did then because it was over priced and not very good. They had an information desk which gave a lot of info on available tours. The tour we went on was a bit of a rip off though and would be interesting to know what if any commission the hotel was getting. In terms of the location you were not really close to anything but it is in Los Angeles where all of the (poor) tourist attractions seem to be 20 miles apart. There is a very handy metro right across the road which is very helpful if you dont have a car. The bus out to Santa Monica goes right past the hotel as well. You are about 30 mins from downtown and I made the ridiculous decision to try and walk it. Very very scary walk which I definitely would not recommend - stick to the bus/metro. I did not find any of the restauraunts around there very nice and the one in the hotel was just a rip off. Ended up having to go to Denny's. Overall not a bad stay. Safe bet but might be able to do better.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay there ever again! You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to valet, the exterior and lobby seemed nice. Checked in, went to my room on the 11th floor. Rooms are very out dated, mattress sucked, toilet wouldn't flush, both hot and cold faucets in the bathroom leaked, carpet was dirty and buckled. Went to get ice on the 11th floor and the machine was completely out of ice, had to go to the 10th floor for ice. Windows in the room are very thin and sound is a huge issue, even though being on the 11th floor, vehicle and crowd noise kept me awake all night and morning. Last but not least, went to take a shower and the bath towels were the size of a dinner napkin, could have used 4 to dry myself off but were only 2 in the room. The property is comparable to a large scale Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend the "THE WILSHIRE HOTEL"”
Reviews.Author: A'S B
Reviews.Content: I have read some of the bad review and i totally disagree. Lets all be honest here before we give bad review. 1st the hotel is very affordable i dont think you'll be able to find a 3stars hotel better than "The Wilshire Hotel", I mean if your expecting a luxury type room maybe put more money in that bank account! come on now!! lets keep it real! Anyway I travel to LA every weekend for business purposes and I always stayed at this hotel,, its comfy and employee are very nice and always smiling =). I feel safe staying here, and just based on my experience the hotel employee will do their best to provide what ever necessary. Thanks to the Manager by the name of ''Yvonne" Appriciate the help and hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “A Filmmaker's Perspective”
Reviews.Author: Eric B
Reviews.Content: I am a filmmaker and I shot a scene for an independent film at the Wilshire Hotel in Mid-Wilshire ( K-Town) . My experience was wonderful, and Iâ€™m very glad I decided to work with the Wilshire Hotel. Itâ€™s style and look is that of an old Los Angeles high-end hotel like the Millennium Biltmore down the street, and with very reasonable pricing. What you get for your dollar here makes the stay well worth it. My experience shooting at the Wilshire Hotel was as easy as it gets. The staff is pleasant, unobtrusive, professional, and knowledgeable. The views of Hollywood are second to none, and their junior suites have plenty of room for any kind of shot youâ€™re looking for. If youâ€™re looking for the downtown feel, or the Hollywood feel, then check out the Wilshire Hotel. I also slept there for a night, and the room was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lobby Motel Rooms”
Reviews.Author: cuetxpie
Reviews.Content: Having not read any of the previous reviews, I was shocked to find the extreme difference between the exterior of the building/lobby and the actual hotel room itself. From the outside, the Wilshire Hotel appeared like any typical hotel: located on a busy street, valet parking (not free), bland looking building, etc. The lobby was welcoming. It had a well sized bar area with flat screen TVs which had on different games. There was also another coffee bar that served coffee and tea and breakfast goods. Overall, when you took it all in, it felt as if this was a pretty fancy hotel. However, I was disappointed when I opened the door to room #340. The room completely threw me off! The light in the corridor didn't work. The carpet was incredibly dirty. After fidgeting around with the old fashion circular thermostat, we finally got it to work: on or off. Even though it was set to be 70 degrees, it just kept on getting hotter and hotter. (YIKES!) The restroom was compact, which was fine. But the towels weren't clean very well. In addition, the water pressure for the shower was pretty weak and the water wasn't as hot as I liked it. (I like it hot!) Restroom amenities: Blow dryer, one-cup serving coffee maker, lotion, shampoo, soap All in all, it's OK for a one night stay. Would I stay here again? No. It's convenient if you're dependent on the Metro as your main form of transportation in LA (the Purple Line's Wilshire/Normandie is literally right across the street). Just don't be deceive by the facade~ It's a hotel downstairs; but it's a motel upstairs!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great concierge Jose, central location, comfy”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraChiangMai
Reviews.Content: If you're on foot in LA (God forbid!) as we were, this hotel is great. You can easily get to bus or metro. It's in walking distance from the Shriner's Hospital (our destination). It's the perfect place for families heading to that hospital. The lobby atmosphere is friendly, the concierge (Jose) was super helpful to us with an assortment of questions and arrangements, the front desk staff is nice too. The cafe and bar in the lobby are friendly and just right for casual meetings. The room was quite OK, and it's affordable when booked on line. We felt at home here. We'll definitely come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go here”
Reviews.Author: verorella
Reviews.Content: I almost feel bad for giving this hotel a bad review but being honest about my experience so that other travellers can be aware before choosing this hotel. The saying, "it's about all Location, Location, Location" rings true, and sadly this hotel does not have it. First, our room was facing a main road. If you're a light sleeper or easily distracted by traffic noises, you're best to come prepared with own ear plugs or better yet, choose another hotel. Second, we parked right outside the hotel, and the next morning, the roof rack was stolen off the location. Of course this isn't the hotel's fault but just a warning to others about the location. Although the hotel description says it's minutes away from nice neighborhoods such as Beverly Hills and Rodeo Drive, it is nowhere nearby. Just a few more incidences that added to a bad experience: the toilet was clogged (although the staff fixed it promptly), no one was at the front desk for check-in right away, and the bath towels was a tiny piece of rough loin cloth.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading- Don't Waste Your Money”
Reviews.Author: pixiedustgrl245
Reviews.Content: Once you enter the lobby you think you're about to enter a gorgeous hotel room, however the rooms looks like that of motels and smell like cheap motels as well. The hotel is in an area where there is nothing to do and the most fun I had was visiting a CVS a few blocks down the road. I was expecting so much more form The Willshire Hotel and was let down. They need to revamp their rooms to match the quality you see in the lobby because it is incredibly misleading for customers and increases the let down once you see your room. If you're visiting LA I recommend shelling out the extra cash for a convenient spot and nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, safe area and well connected to major attractions”
Reviews.Author: foodie_charlotte
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and 5 days. The hotel is located in the heart of Koreatown area of LA city. The Metro subway is right across the road from the hotel, thus its well conected to the main attractions like downtown LA, Universal Studios and Hollywood Blvd, Rodeo Dr. There is a Starbucks cafe in the hotel lobby which is good to grab a quick bite. The hotel seems to be an old property. The rooms are very ok, we were always out for the entire day and came back late night so it didnt matter if the rooms werent fancy enough.They definitey need to change the carpet, drapes and comforters as you can tell how old they are. The room service was good. We had booked this hotel through bookit.com and had got a free upgrade to deluxe king room with a view. The lobby staff honored that and we got a room on the 12th floor with a view of Hollywood sign and area which was pretty cool. The hotel staff/ concierge was good, offered us good advice about city sightseeing. Although, dont go for the grand city view tour offered by them, its a waste of money. LA is very well connected so you can go anywhere on your own, just keep a map with you. The hotel area is Koreatown so mostly you will see Korean restaurants in the vicinity but again you can catch the 720 Metro rapid or the subway train to get to other spots. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is a traveller because its safe, well connected and service quality is ok.

Reviews.Title: “better business alert”
Reviews.Author: k c
Reviews.Content: What you see is not what you get! The website shows one hotel, the reality is the total opposite. In each of our three rooms, we had one or more of these issues: thermostats, tv, remote, iron that didn't work; linens that didn't fit the beds; towels thin and small - similar to rags; iron board, hangars, luggage racks that were nonexistent; nonsmoking room that smelled of smoke; torn and stained carpeting; and more. After several attempts to share our concerns and finally a statement that this was a Better Business Bureau issue, management offered to change our rooms The result....more of the same. The hotel stated that they are under construction; although there was no evidence of this.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here....”
Reviews.Author: FreeMetalMonkey
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff are non-chalant. Didn't even get a smile when I checked. I paid the higher rate for "a room w/ a view"...what I was given was an eighth floor looking at the roof top of another building. The official hotel website AND the website booked (orbitz) was so misleading. The pictures of the "room w/ a view" were updated rooms (the picture shows the baby blue pillows on bed) but they only have a "few" of these rooms and the rest, including the one I was given was a dump. I don't why I payed the higher rate when the room was as crappy as the cheaper rate? I spoke to "Johana", Assistant Manager and she told me there was nothing she could do or change. She lacked empathy and had a bad attitude. I asked that she discount parking (which would have made up for the difference in price of room) but she said it was owned by a private company. The room was a total dive! Outdated, smelly in a non-smoking room, stains on carpet, rusty bathroom, the list goes on! Thank GOD, I only stayed for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Junghee
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself, and our 5 months old daughter traveled to LA to see our friends and families. We chose this hotel for its location. The first night the heater was blowing cold air and I called the front desk and asked for portable heater. Without apology, she simply said the engineer would come to take a look at it. NO ONE CAME and didn't bring the heater. Next morning, I was in the shower when the water turned COLD! What the... I waited few minutes but still cold!!! I came out and spoke with the manager. She was nicer than the previous staff but still annoying. She asks me why I didn't call back for the heater!! How many times do I have to call? This place is soooo not worth the money and my experience here was horrible. Also with the $25 parking fee, the price here is just as expensive as other hotels. Go to the OTHER ONES!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Brooke S
Reviews.Content: We were in LA filming a TV shoot for the week and a lot of us were first time LA-ers. Everyone from the front desk to the valet service to the concierge were exceptionally friendly and went above and beyond to display exemplary service to our entire cast and crew. Ray and Jose, our concierge were beyond kind in helping with even the smallest of requests. They made our 5 days in LA a pleasurable working experience. So glad we decided not to continue our stay at Hollywood Hotel after receiving TERRIBLE service from Devon their receptionist. They lost a couple grand that day thats for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bonzaAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in August 2011 for 5 nights. Bedding needs replacing, carpets stained. Locationwise brilliant, across the road from the Metro and the Rapid 720 which goes along Wilshire Boulevard to Santa Monica. Hotel staff helpful, happy hour Mon to Fri bartender (coloured) guy was very efficient, cannot say same for other bar staff.

Reviews.Title: “First time stay in LA!”
Reviews.Author: Hannah F
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was pretty impressive for the price my friend and I paid for a 12 day trip to LA. The Hotel staff are very friendly, very responsive and always willing to assist you. We stayed in one of their 'Standard Guest Rooms', it was large enough for us - having two double beds, a large desk, and a TV. Our only issue with the room was having no fridge, as this would have made the stay more comfortable, especially for keeping the drinks cold! In terms of location - it is located right across the street from the Metro Subway Station and this can connect you to various points of interest throughout the city.There s also the bus service which is no walk at all. They have a beautiful Garden area with an outdoor swimming pool (only thing with this is it faces the roadside, so it tends to get quite a bit of traffic noise) As the hotel is centrally located in the Wilshire Center business district, we found that it was a prime location for the business, corporate, and government types rather than the typical tourist type. Overall, we were impressed with the look and feel of the place and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT value, GREAT service”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_Peterson
Reviews.Content: I needed to stay in LA for a two day layover from NY to far East and found this hotel to be just what the doctor ordered. Is this a five star hotel? No, but at 25% to 30% of the price, it delivers a good experience for a decent value. The room was spacious and clean. The comforter was tired, but I never leave those on the bed even in the finest hotels. The room temperature was fine, the view was art deco 1930's LA. The location is ideal for getting around. Rapid transit is literally right outside the door with both bus and metro service. I'm kind of into the historical LA and Koreatown is right in the midst of this. Down the street from the Wilshire Temple and the Wiltern Theatre and minutes by car or Metro from VERY fine dining in downtown LA or Beverly Hills. The staff was fantastic. From the front desk to the cleaning staff, the attitude is great and extremely responsive. They moved me from a regular room to an accessible room (I have a prosthetic leg) without any difficulty. You'd be surprised how many "five star" hotels can't manage that, or have accessible rooms 250 yards from the elevator. A very good experience and I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Koreatown LA”
Reviews.Author: coveredwagon
Reviews.Content: Decent accomodations at a value price. No fridge and a weak a/c system were drawbacks and the soap bars were as small as I've ever seen but on the plus side, the LA subway purple line is immediatly accross the street and the 20 and 720 busses are right outside. The trains are efficient and inexpensive both to Union Station Hollywood Highlands There is a just fair restaurant on the prem and a second floor outdoor pool. The staff is more than helpful. It was facinating to watch the Korea air stewardesses meetinng in the lobby, each and every one perfect. There is a gift shop and taxi stand on the first (lobby) floor There can be quite a bit of traffic noise even though we were on the 9th floor. All in all it was fine for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service”
Reviews.Author: sarahmarie611
Reviews.Content: When I called to make reservations, Derek, the man who took my reservation went out of his way to accommodate by every need. Amazing service.

Reviews.Title: “Staff needs a lesson in customer service”
Reviews.Author: StarBrigt7
Reviews.Content: My friend and I began booking our trip several weeks ahead before we realized that we'd decided to travel to LA during VMA weekend. So, hotel pickings were slim. My friend found this hotel on one of the travel websites and the pictures of the hotel's lobby and rooms were actually quite nice so we chose to stay there based on the price and the pictures. Well, the hotel is in Korea town, its lobby is quite photogenic and I think they probably photographed one of their remodeled rooms which we obviously didn't get to see. We were situated on the 12th floor and once we walked into our room we realized it was a little warm. We just assumed the high temperature was due to the curtains having been open all day and the ac being shut off. So, we turned it down and waited for it to cool. By the time we realized it wasn't happening we'd already unpacked and had begun getting ready for dinner. So we decided to give it the night and would ask for another room in the morning if the situation didn't improve. While we were on our way out the next morning, we asked that someone be sent to our room to check on the ac. When we returned SEVERAL hours later, we realized it was still quite warm so we called the front desk and no they hadn't come so we waited patiently for the technician to arrive. Once he did and tinkered around the unit for a bit he said "it's better, but it's still not good" so he put in a request for another room. They were nice enough to put us in another room just a few doors down so we didn't have to repack all of our belongings to move to another floor. Unfortunately, the AC in room number two really wasn't any better and we spent the remainder of the weekend fanning ourselves as we applied our makeup. I'm not sure if the problem is on the 12th floor or if it's in the entire hotel, but when you can't open the windows in the room the AC really needs to work. The room itself wasn't dirty, but it didn't feel clean and the comforters looked like they'd never been washed, EVER. Of course, we threw all that stuff off the beds anyway. Oh, and did I mention there's no fridge? A warm room without cold water is a bad combination. Just in case you're wondering, no I don't plan on staying here again & you probably shouldn't either. While I agree that "you get what you pay for," in a hotel some things should just be standard...like a working AC.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, sub par accomodations”
Reviews.Author: HossSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Booked a King view room on Hotel.com. Location was convenient for business. Upon arrival I was advised at fron desk the hotel was fully booked. Someone needed to physically examine rooms to see which were available. After waiting 20 to 30 minutes in the lobby (I had flown into LA and driven from the airport at 9:30 PM) I was told the only King room they had had just had the carpets cleaned and the floor was still wet. I was offered a room with 2 double beds which I accepted. It was on the 4th Floor facing Wilshire. They gave me a $5 discount on the valet parking bringing it down to $15 from $20. They room was very shabby. The furniture had many chips and the carpet was stained. The sheets had been thrown on the bed but never tucked in. One of the pillows smelled of perfume. The tile in the bathroom was chipped. Although the location, was convenient I will avoid this hotel in the future. The hotel said it had a King room available on Hotels.com when it did not. I had paid in advance non-refundable and feel that I was misled. I would not trust this place.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: Angela2031
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were not allowed an early check in, which was fine. When we returned to bring our belongings up to our room, it took the bellhop 20 minutes to unlock our luggage. The room needed some serious updating, furniture, bedding and pillows were horrible, bathroom was short on towels (which were tiny to begin with) and the air conditioning was blasting and we couldn't shut it off. I suppose the value was good for staying in the hollywood area ($100/night), but I wouldn't return to this hotel again...pay the extra $20-40 to get a decent hotel!!! Also, they force you to take valay parking ($20 per day), but that was probably the best part, service was pretty good and staff was friendly/helpful.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel in LA but not my first choice”
Reviews.Author: MelodySPerry
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for my boyfriends birthday mainly because of the price. it was easy to get to from the airport, and because we rented a car we didnt mind driving where we wanted to go. the rooms were ok(definitely needs some updating), but we were rarely at the hotel so it didnt bother us too much. the parking was pretty expensive($35/day for valet) theres a lot of resturants in the area, but really not too much nightlife if thats what your looking for. id recommend more fore business travelers than anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Jo the manager = excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Andrew111111
Reviews.Content: Hotel is really nice but mostly our stay has been amazing with the people that run wilshire . Especially the manager jo , she has been really helpful and patient , jo is brilliant with customer service and has made us feel really welcome and at ease which are paramount when travelling to places unknown . Thank you for your help jo and we appreciate it . Ps your cool :)

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and definately will return like we have many times before”
Reviews.Author: leighaus
Reviews.Content: this was our 4th visit to the wilshire plaza we loved it. great affordable rates, great clean rooms, no noise at night. the staff are absolutely amazing and helpful the concierge Jose gave us great tips to find our destinations the easiest way also by organising our shuttle buses on time :) this hotel is straight across from wilshire/normandie station perfect for getting you to hollywood, union station, long beach,universal, even lax airport. the 720 buses right outside aswell they coming all the time for santa monica beverly hills farmers market also to downtown la. the area is very safe its knowen as korean town asian places around great food :) breakfast buffet is sooooo nice yummmyyy ANYONE GOING TO LA THIS HOTEL IS A MUST YOU ARE IN A GREAT LOCATION VERY SHORT TRAIN TRIPS OR BUS TRIPS TO LAS HOT ATTRACTIONS. staff are so good on the front desk aswell hotel is very clean

Reviews.Title: “little bit old but good value for money.okay overall”
Reviews.Author: adrianmiami
Reviews.Content: i stayed for 1 week in august and found it quite pleasant. in koreatown,in front of normandy and wilshire metro station(dont take a cab,it is really just across the street),CENTRALLY LOCATED IN MID WILSHIRE.check in at 3 pm sucks, arrogant concierge even more but the rooms at 100 us with tax for la were okay. lots of people in the hallways and lobby.certainly no cozy boutique like place but 30 minutes from lax and 30 from beverly hills. nice option . better than any motel on sunset. clean and efficient. okay overall for 100 bucks. i stayed befor in the mayfair hotel ,and this one wqas 1000 times better !!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money, even at a discounted rate.”
Reviews.Author: bbucsf
Reviews.Content: We were visiting family in the West Hollywood over Labor Day weekend and just needed a nearby hotel room for the night we arrived. Most things in the area were full or too expensive, and the Wilshire was having a summer sale so we booked a room there. It was a big mistake - I guess if a hotel's having a sale in a weekend where most other hotels are full of guests, it's a bad sign. Like may other reviewers, we were surprised (but not terribly upset) by the $22 mandatory valet parking. What did upset us was the condition of the rooms and the extremely unattentive staff. The beds linens and carpet seemed like they had not been cleaned in some time, and everything smelled very musty like an old closet. The room did not have enough towels etc. for everyone (even though we did make a reservation for 4 adults) and even after calling the front desk twice and coming down in person to ask for more, we still didn't get any until late the next morning. Overall the worst feature for me was the poorly equipped and outdated fitness center. There were only 3 exercise machines in a small room with no fan or ventilation. The treadmill I used was in such poor condition that when I tried running on it, it just flashed error messages about the maintenance it needed, and the other pieces of equipment were in the same shape. I've stayed in dozens of hotels across the country in the past couple of years, and this is the worst fitness center I've seen.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews are right”
Reviews.Author: CTPN
Reviews.Content: Looks great on the website, but many flaws. While it is not hidden, the $22/day parking charge adds to the cost of the room and when driving up to check in, there is nowhere to park so they immediately try to move your car into the valet parking. I asked front desk staff if I would be able to find street parking nearby and they said it was unlikely, although on the second day I did find a metered spot nearby, although it wouldn't have been convenient for parking throughout the day. The room was in serious need of more cleaning. The carpet was dirty and had not been installed correctly so it was bunching up in places. There was no fridge, and the ice dispenser on the ninth floor was not working, so we had to throw away some food that we had thought we would be able to keep. On the positive side, the pool is good, the location across the street from a Metro station is excellent. I would stay here only if your options are limited. We did not have a room booked for the last couple of nights of our stay so our options were limited. I wouldn't call it a disaster, but for the location and price you can do much better if you look around a bit more. Trip Advisor's mixed reviews were right.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fiona W
Reviews.Content: Can't see what the complaints are about with this hotel. Stayed here for a week as part of a family holiday and enjoyed a lovely, hospitable stay in the Wilshire Hotel. We had a room on the fourth floor, vastly spacious, clean and with all of the amenities one could need (hairdryer, iron, coffee machine etc.). The room was cleaned daily, whether a sign requesting this was left on the door or not. The cleaner also confirmed with you if you left a sign saying that you did not want the room cleaned. The room has a modern look, with floor to ceiling windows, giving an airy feeling to the room, allowing it to feel cooler in the warm summer temperatures. It is also decorated with pale walls and clean, white linens, allowing a fresh ethos. There is minimal noise throughout the night which does not disturb sleep. The beds are large and comfortable. The staff are all friendly and ready to help happily when contacted at the front desk. Having met one front desk worker on the street, having realized we were staying at the hotel, insisted that he take our luggage in for us. The area, in Koreatown, is easily accessible both by bus and Metro, both which are located directly outside of the hotel. The hotel is in a good area for getting to Rodeo Drive and Santa Monica, both which are accessed directly down Wilshire Blvd on the 720 bus. The purple line Metro connects to the red line after one stop takes you into Hollywood. It costs $5 for a day ticket to use both Metro and bus. The hotel has gym and pool facilities, as well as a Starbucks in the lobby, a gift shop and a restaurant. The pool is located on the 2nd floor on a terrace with a sun area around it. The gym is on the 11th floor, providing beautiful views of Los Angeles and the Hollywood Sign. It is equipped with treadmills, weights, exercise bike etc and also provides free water, towels and toilet facilities. There are plenty of places to eat on the street opposite, ranging from a McDonalds to a Japanese restaurant, which I would definitely recommend. There is also a CVS down the road which sells everything, and has a Denny's Diner opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother asking for towels”
Reviews.Author: juliettt
Reviews.Content: BAD: When we called downstairs to get a couple more towels, they never came. The floors were dirty and the entire place smelled like cigarettes! Everything from the elevators and concierge service seemed to run in slow motion... we literally had to wait 10 minutes for the elevator to come down. We also waited 15-20 minutes to talk to the concierge as he was trying to sort out a couple (which isn't entirely his fault, but we had places to go). GOOD: Close to the trains and also nearby (fast) food outlets. We had a quiet stay and they had a late checkout time.

Reviews.Title: “no reason to come back here”
Reviews.Author: TiffaniVictoria
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband as part of a package trip. There is valet parking with a nightly charge of $22. The lobby is impressive and nicely appointed with a lounge and Starbucks. The front desk staff was consistently abrupt to everyone. Our room was on the 6th floor, with a distant view of the Hollywood sign and Griffith Observatory. The carpet in the room was stained and disgusting but otherwise the linens and surfaces were clean. Bathroom was updated and room amenities were adequate. The location was easy to find, but not much around. Located in Koreatown and mostly financial buildings. There were some small cafes and lots of Korean BBQ. We asked the concierge for a casual place for dinner; he sent us to a nasty looking drinking establishment, so this did not impress us. We ended up trying Korean BBQ which was very good and a really neat experience. We could not find anywhere to have breakfast other than the lobby cafe, and no staff available, so drove to a restaurant. Would not go back to this hotel, as it really needs some attention and the rude staff (note the valet parking staff were very nice) turned us off completely.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting - BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: Alex M
Reviews.Content: Buyer Beware!! I booked this hotel online, the photos that they have posted are of the 3 renovated rooms - keep in mind that there are 385 total rooms!! The room we were given had ripped up, faded and stained carpet...the bedding looked dirty and worn, there were stains on the walls and chairs, cracks along the ceiling and the odor was appalling!! Upon inspection of the room, we then had to fight tooth and nail to get our money refunded and find another hotel to stay in...all this late at night and with a staff that was horribly inept and rude. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to my worst enemy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Allie_Novaa
Reviews.Content: Overall I thought this hotel was very good. The lobby was really nice and although the room wasn't super, the staff made me feel great. Special thanks to Susy who helped me while I was checking in. She directed me to Taylor stake house one night and I had an amazing meal with a friend. This hotel is clearly not up to date, but I enjoyed the service they gave me.

Reviews.Title: “Los Angeles was the last stop on our trip from San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: TEDDY001
Reviews.Content: To be honest this hotel was in a good location for us - straight road to Santa Monica on the bus!! and the Concierge was very good organising days out but the photo's of the hotel don't really show that it is more than a bit jaded - our toilets blocked and if you didn't remember to put the sign on the door your room didn't automatically get cleaned!! and then there was the road noise, they really need to do a serious upgrade. It's used a lot as a stop over hotel for Korean airlines. Having said that the staff were very helpful and did get our room cleaned and the toilet unblocked!! The food in the restaurant was good but as Europeans we did struggle finding anywhere locally to eat later than 9 o'clock!! And of course you have to ask for "fine dining" otherwise you could get sent to McDonalds or somewhere similar because unlike us they call them restaurants. It is also in what they call Korea town so if you like Korean food it's good and we did find very good Japanese restaurant one night we were also directed to a restaurant called Taylor's where we had great steak. We all enjoyed Los Angeles because there is a lot to see and do

Reviews.Title: “Near public transportation but ghetto area”
Reviews.Author: HeyLC
Reviews.Content: Reserved hotel through Bookit.com. Upon arrival the front desk associate had trouble finding my reservation so she disappeared into the back room for about 20 minutes to look it up. This hotel is directly across the street from the Metro Purple Line: Wilshire / Normandie Station. I arrived at LAX, jumped on the Flyaway bus - Union Station ($7) and took the Metro Purple ($2.50?) to the hotel. I was traveling alone and I must say it was pretty scary at night because you pass through ghetto areas of LA. The hotel is even located in an area nothing like I would imagine for being 20 minutes from Beverly Hills. The hotel/rooms look nothing like it does on the website. Very old, tired, and dirty carpeting. The room size itself was not too bad but the bathroom was small. I got a room away from the street so I had no problem sleeping. The free in-room Wi-Fi was a plus though.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was good but front desk left a lot to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: JohnFoley47
Reviews.Content: After a very early arrival from Aust, we enquired re the possibility of early registration (understanding of course that it MAY not be possible). The female staffer at front desk seemingly took glee in refusing our request despite the obvious low occupancy rate (over the entire 3 days we stayed). While the hotel was a little "tired", it was a good place to stay and represented good value for money. We enjoyed the stay and would return to this hotel again if we could be confidant that staff attitudes would improve. Of the several basic questions we asked about the immediate surrounds e.g. transport, not one was answered with anything other than "I don't know". During our holiday and since then, we have stayed at approximately 15 other hotels and all provided a better front of house experience and response. Overall, the staff experience was a disappointment because the hotel was more than reasonable and a good spot to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have stayed in yet”
Reviews.Author: A11isonlee
Reviews.Content: The Wilshire hotel is the worst hotel I have stayed in yet. My friend and I are driving cross country from NY to LA and back. We have booked many different hotels and this one being one of the more expensive one and also the worst one! We had issues from the moment we walked in. The rooms do have a very outdated feel, which I can handle but make them at least clean! I looked out the window to see the view and my hand turned black from touching the drapes. GROSS! We did not have a fitted sheet and woke up directly on the mattress throughout the night which caused us to get up a couple times to "fix" the bedding. The hotel responded by saying that not every floor has fitted sheets....WHAT?!?! We also had internet problems which was a nuisance as I had work to complete while traveling. If you need internet do not stay on the 12th floor as you do not get a signal. (This was adv'd to us by hotel staff when I called to ask). Also I had to go to 6 different floors for Ice the morning I was leaving. I just wanted one ice bucket for my cooler and it took me demanding ice from the front desk before they went to find ice. NEVER AGAIN! I'll pay more money to stay somewhere else next time I am in LA

Reviews.Title: “Your webpage is amazing...that was not the room we got!”
Reviews.Author: teachkgn
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Wilshire Hotel for two reasons....first it was close to the Hollywood Bowl and second...it looked like a beautiful place to stay from the website photos and design. With the name Wilshire comes a sense of style in California but not with this place. The lobby is beautiful. I was excited to see what kind of room we would be staying in. We got there an hour early and asked for early check in and were sent away being told to return at 3. Twenty minutes later we walked back into the lobby and everyone was checking. So back in line we went. Got our room and went up to the 12th floor. When I opened the door I thought I was being punked. There were big stains on the carpet. The room decor is very outdated. The bed was hard and had old worn bedding. Not what we expected. When we asked to be moved, the response was that "we are completely sold out!" There were many big travel groups and airline personel staying in the hotel. We chatted with others by the pool and they too said that the website photos are deceiving. The front desk crew was moderately friendly and offered to comp our parking! $22 dollars I usually only write positive reviews so that I can share good experiences with others in my shoes. BUT this not a hotel I can reccommend for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: adventuretraveler54
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on Wilshire Blvd, which is main east-west street. There is not a lot around the hotel for tourist. However the metro (bus) comes every 15 minutes right out front and for $1.50 you can go to Rodeo/Wilshire or Santa Monica/Wilshire- 3rd Street Promenade in less than 1/2 hour. Restaurant at hotel, The Terrace is good for breakfast. Rooms facing Wilshire are loud, better to be facing the rear of hotel. We left a bracelet on bed on check out day, and came back 3 hours later to claim our bags (stored at concierge desk) and reported it to security. They went to room and housekeeping and it had been turned in. I was so thrilled to get it back. So kudo's to the staff for honesty/integrity

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: angie_ng01
Reviews.Content: Good value. Pictures are not deceiving. Rooms are clean, comfort, bright, nice view and large enough, nothing was broken... A Starbucks bar located in the lobby. Right across the street is a subway station with easy access to almost every main attractions of LA. However, the front desk staff were not very friendly (but the man at the information desk was helpful). Wi-Fi was super low so we had to bring devices to the lobby for better signal Probably will be back !

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel to stay for the price & location in LA”
Reviews.Author: travlady2
Reviews.Content: Husband & family stayed here during our visit to LA. The hotel is a good value...although it is not in the same league as a Hilton...we found the rooms to be very neat and clean...the maid service was very nice and offered us as many towels as we wanted. The service was good...our TV was not working and they came and repaired it in minutes. The restaurant served deliciious food at very reasonable prices. We were able to print our boarding passes out at no charge and having the parking facility on the premises was good because there is no parking on the streets. Although the hotel is located in the downtown corporte area there are buses that run up & down Wilshire Blvd. to go into the main tourist area of Hollywood. We would recommend staying here for anyone on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but traffic noise was terrible”
Reviews.Author: tanya123-11
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel generally but it would benefit from double glazing. We had very little sleep for the 4 nights due to the traffic noise

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: Tarafn
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice enough. The lobby was marble, staff pleasent. The room was dated and the double beds were small but I didn't wake up with a sore back. We used Book-it.com and had no problems

Reviews.Title: “Lovely reception but the room was a little tired!”
Reviews.Author: louandcolin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and used the hotel as a base. It was quite far away from all of the main attractions we wanted to go to (Hollywood) but the subway was located across the road. The room was very clean and safe but was lacking something.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your money”
Reviews.Author: realestateden
Reviews.Content: Stay someplace else. Staff was terrible and rude. The fitness room had only broken equipment. The towels were see thru and thread bare. Stained carpets in rooms and hallways. Elevators hardly work and pool is a mini pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel, useless staff”
Reviews.Author: StanleyPark2011
Reviews.Content: The location is decent for getting around the major sights. You've got to try a Korean BBQ when staying in the area (Soot Bull Jeep was great). It seems the management are too busy repsonding to reviews on here than to emails directed to the hotel that were read and ignored! Terrible customer service and the awful front desk staff are only following the example set by the management.

Reviews.Title: “I liked their hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Gourmetboss
Reviews.Content: We reahed late in the evening but the welcome we received at the check in counter was really amazing! A special mention for Ms. Johanna who was very helpful and efficient. We were in our rooms in flat 10 minutes from the time we reached. The rooms are spacious and I would say by all standards a good value for money!! They certainly need to do something about their Internet which is hardly available in the room and every time you need to use it one has to go down to the lobby. overall experience was good and would certainly stay their again during our next vsit.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing - the front desk staff are all hopeless”
Reviews.Author: mb02
Reviews.Content: The only plus of this hotel is the location and again l have stayed in better places in LA. We will not be back. The staff at the front desk were rude and unhelpful we watched them with other guests and there attitude was the same. Thinking we got them on a bad day we expected it to improve - nope.. We arrived at Midnight and had advised the hotel our room was gone so we were downgraded it was fine we were tired just wanted to sleep no bellman to help with luggage and no offers. We asked for directions a number of times and got better advice out on the street, The bathroom had mould in a number of spots and the hotel is in major need of a refurb. The lift jerks and one night the bell was ringing for half an hour as it was broken and you could hear it all throughout our level. All in all, don't do it there is much better to be had..

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the pictures!”
Reviews.Author: FIDMmom
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I traveled to Los Angeles to visit a school, and this hotel was very close to it. The pictures on their website looked very nice. When we arrived, the outside looked nice, and the lobby was very nice. We booked a king-size bed, with a view of the "Hollywood" sign. The room they gave us was a double, with a view. As soon as you get off the elevator, the first thing you notice is the dim lights and the stained carpet. The room stunk, the carpet was light tan - and VERY dirty, the "view" showed the Hollywood sign very far away, and the rest of the "view" was rooftops. The furniture was old wooden furniture with chunks out of it, all over. I went to the front desk, and out of frustration and exhaustion, I literally cried! I asked for another room. Was given one two floors up. The hallways were brighter, and the room was a little better. Didn't smell. Carpets were dirty, bed skirts wrinkled and had holes, curtains were dirty, garbage on the desk chair, rusty and chipped bathroom door, leaky faucets.....need I go on!. Sheets were clean. No bed bugs. Parking is Valet only, and cost $22 per night. I requested and received a reduction to $15 per night since we were staying for six nights. NO FREE BREAKFAST! Breakfast buffet was available at $17.00 per person! No thanks. Found a Denny's up the street. Staff and valet were all very polite and helpful. So far. After returning home I found a $180 charge on my checking account from the hotel. I phoned and was told that they put a $180 hold on the account for any incidentals we might need. I was NEVER told about this, and now my account is overdrawn. I am still waiting to hear back from them as to how they are going to rectify this. If I get overdraft fees, I am requesting the hotel pay them.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: royaleonar
Reviews.Content: You to pay for the valet parking and its expensive. Theres no signal for wifi internet in the rooms - only in lobby!

Reviews.Title: “the trip was good enough 2 make me move here lol”
Reviews.Author: sketch7art
Reviews.Content: living in cleveland ohio and then on a trip to LA. u see a huge difference in people and culture. Not knowing my way around or what sites to see an employee Thip was quite helpful, he told me all about koreatown and the fashion district. He was very kind, the hotel is great so all in all i had a great visit and now i currently live in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect to get what you book...”
Reviews.Author: boogierum
Reviews.Content: My mother has never traveled a great deal, has never flown, and I booked a room here back in February on Bookit.com that was supposed to have a view of the Hollywood sign. The photo of the room looked like a Hilton or Hyatt-comparable property. I arrived late in the evening because of a delayed flight from Nashville, and was told that no Hollywood views were available. The hotel was sold out. I was told to check back in the morning. I checked this morning. (I am staying here as I write this review.) I was told there would be no availability on the Hollywood side even later today. I just don't think it's fair to guarantee a particular perk as part of a rate MONTHS IN ADVANCE and then not be able to fulfill that promise. I would probably have booked elsewhere had I known I would not get the view I was offered. The room I received was also very plain--nothing like the one in the photograph at the time of booking. I will post photographs later. I plan to be here for five more days, but this will likely be my last time to stay at the Wilshire. Just be forewarned when you book.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: shallhouston
Reviews.Content: This hotel was was not up to my standard . It wasdirty and very old and smell like urine. The bedding was old and stained.The carpet was dirty with stains as well. They also made us pay for parking.The pictures from online was totally different than what was presented.I was very unhappy with my stay at the wilshire hotel.It made my experience in la horrible . Strongly not recomended to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: RCT_10
Reviews.Content: We made reservations from Bookit.com so they were non refundable or we would not of stayed. We entered a musky smelling room that had a iron burn mark in the carpeting. The hot water never got more than luke warm. We had room next to the gym and woke up to someone running/ thumping the treadmill to the point the bed vibrated. The parking is required valet and the valet personnel are extremely rude. On the good side, the lobby and lobby bar is very nice. It is also located in the middle of Korea town....not much shopping or tourist attractions within walking.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless you like Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: Iamvonda
Reviews.Content: I am totally amazed at the good reviews I have read on this hotel. I stayed here back in April and couldn't wait till my stay was over. To start off, the check-in was a disaster. We had made reservations under a friends name. The check-in clerk couldn't find our reservation with our confirmation number. After some time we were finally checked in. The room we were given was typical of a Motel 6 setting. The pillows were compressed and they only gave us 2 for our King size bed. The towels were hard. The carpet and wall[paper definetely have been there for many years and showed wear and tear. Overall I just felt dirty in this very small space. When we went to bed we turned the air conditioning on since the room was warm. It never worked. At 11pm we finally called downstairs and demanded another room with working air. Got moved at midnight. Very restless night. The price was cheap and now I know why.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and central at a fantastic price!”
Reviews.Author: JenJen85254
Reviews.Content: We found out my Dad's favorite comedian was playing in LA a week before his birthday. It was a last minute deal and was only 10 minutes from the theater in Hollywood. We booked based on the phenomenal price and it was as close as we could get without breaking the bank. We booked two rooms -both were very clean, and had a view of the mountains (and the rooftops of the old buildings next door!) The staff were excellent checking us in and got a fridge up to one of the rooms within an hour of checkin. My parents enjoyed a drink in the bar after the show, and Starbucks has a location in the lobby which was very convienent. The noise was fine -once you were in your room you hardly heard what was going on outside. The hotel was excellent value and clean. The only downsides being I wouldn't be comfortable walking around outside at night, and could probably do with a bit updating.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, Brilliant just Brilliant !!!”
Reviews.Author: ldavies89
Reviews.Content: Absolutly loved this hotel ! i am very shocked about he bad reviews people have wrote on this lovely hotel - they obviously dont know what there on about haha. Me and my partner arrived here 10th may - very polite staff on reception, the hotel room was lovely and luxurious, i loved the reception area, very posh! I think its a great location - easy access to santa monica, straight on the bus outside the hotel takes you to the beach and to get to hollywood jump on the subway opposite the hotel for $6 allday and it goes straight to hollywood boulevard where you will find (chinese theatre, walk of fame, madame tussuads, etc). I will definately be visiting this hotel when i next visit L.A! Thanks for a very welcoming relaxing stay at your hotel, WELL WORTHIT!

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravcl
Reviews.Content: Its a great location, and the hotel may be a bit old but atleast they are well stafffed and resourced..the rooms are clean and we were given the room upon arrival at no extra cost ...which is great when you arrive from Aus. There is no need to feel unsafe and public transport even buses are good and you can rely on them......note that main things are hollywood and santa monica and you can easily access this from this hotel on bus and train

Reviews.Title: “helpful”
Reviews.Author: ilovetotravel20148
Reviews.Content: We had a delay and Johanna was helpful in making things work for us. We originally booked a room with a view of the Hollywood sign, and you can see it from the higher floors. Our room was OK, but there was not a view. (we checked in very late so that could be a reason) Overall, we didn't have much time here, but it was acceptable and we felt comfortable here. Thanks to Johanna for her help

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: killbot2000
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my girlfriend. Checked in with a nice girl all smiles. She insisted that you need a car for LA we didn't, I think they were trying to get us to rent a car. Checked in went to the room, it's was the wrong room I had booked a king room with a view I got a two single beds with no view, but it was ok called down they sorted everything for us. The room was fine nothing special clean and comfortable its all i wanted. In the morning went to the restaurant for breakfast there was a buffet all the food was cold and it cost 35 dollars, we complained about it being cold and they knocked off 2 dollars but we never went back there for breakfast or dinner for that matter. The best thing about the hotel is the location subway right across the road easy to get to universal and we managed to get to 6 flags aswell all with public transport. 5 nights 2 people 400 euro

Reviews.Title: “Avoid. needed renovating 20 years ago”
Reviews.Author: PhilipBloom
Reviews.Content: Beyond tired. Dirty. Bed I dont want to sleep in. When we challenged manager saying rooms look nothing like pictures Yvonne said "oh rooms on website are sample pictures not represantive of the actual rooms" Incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than the price suggests”
Reviews.Author: beauxl2002
Reviews.Content: Maybe I`m just a bit of a peasant or something but this hotel was fantastic for 3 stars. Location is good if you have a car, and PERFECT if you are attempting LA via public transport. Apart from the run to / from LAX we saw everything (Santa Monica, Beverley Hills, Burbank, Hollywood, Long Beach, Downtown etc) via the Metro system for just $6 a day. And there is a stop right opposite the hotel on Wilshire Blvd. The rooms are perfectly adequate for visiting the city. If you want to spend your whole time in the room, pick the Beverley Hills Hotel, or better yet another city. Far too much to see in LA to hang around in the room! Having said that, bed was large, appointed well, and if you ask for a back facing room its quiet and has a great view of the Hollywood sign. The car service they provide to LAX is also excellent. Same flat rate as a cab ($55) but its a brand new Lincoln limo. Stay here when in LA (and your not a movie star)

Reviews.Title: “Bitten by Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: DonovanK
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for my friend at this hotel (Radisson Hotel, aka 'The Wilshire Hotel') from 3/8~3/10/2011 and got Room 1107. My friend was bitten by bed bugs on his hands and legs - confirmed by a doctor. I confronted the hotel manager of this matter, and was told that she will investigate and return to me. No action has taken place since. Bed bugs are extremely difficult to eradicate as my friend and I have learned. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “SCARED!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel53449
Reviews.Content: I booked a room from the website, I had thought it to be the perfect location! We arrived and noticed how nice the lobby was, and thought the rest of the hotel would look just as nice since seeing the photos on the website.....boy was I wrong....rooms where old & beaten, even the wall paper was pealing!!! The view was nice, but the Hollywood sign is not as close as they show....long story sort, we slept there only one night! I kept tissue in my ears in fear that something my crawl in!!!! Never will I go back!!! SCARY!!! PS. Pool was nice!

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Kaycie921
Reviews.Content: Despite a really good website, this hotel leaves a lot to be desired. Nothing was terrible, but nothing was really good either. As others have noted, the rooms are VERY outdated. Old bedding, drab furnishings, bad TV. One of the reasons I chose this hotel was because it had a fitness center, however nowhere on the website does it say that the fitness center doesn't open until 8 a.m.!!! For business travelers and early risers like me, opening at 8 a.m. is absolutely worthless. If I had known that ahead of time, I would never have decided to stay here. Aside from the fitness center, there is nothing here that would bring me back. I will say, however, that the bartenders pour a nice big glass of wine! Good thing, because I needed it to fall asleep in those beds!

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience. will not recommend nor return”
Reviews.Author: pmhein
Reviews.Content: LA was the 3rd city in a row of our citytrip. It must be said: our previous hotels were luxuory hotels and awesome. We did expect the worst of Wilshire knowing all reviews of tripadvisor.com Our arrival was ok, a pleasant woman helped us friendly and effective. The room was outdated, but was expected. We did try to contact frontdesk to ask if a renovated room was applicable. A grumpy man told us the hotel did not have any renovated rooms and hung up! 15 mins later we had some trouble with WiFi, called the frontdesk again for some instructions "WiFi is working ok, probably your settings" the same grumpy man even more rude.Hardly half an hour later we discovered the toilet wasn't draining it was even flooding and called frontdesk again. Grumpy man sighed, didn't believe me and after another explanation he'd sent an engineer right away. Half hr later engineer didn't show up and called again. I don't mind waiting if I know I have to wait. 20 mins later still no engineer.. it took almost 1,5h for an 'engineer' to show up and fix the toilet. Since it was flooded a cleaninglady would be sent. Went across the street for internet cafe since WiFi still not ok, no stabile connection. Returning after an hour, the bathroom was not cleaned. so I went to look for a cleaning lady myself.. frontdesk seemed not reliable! This was just the 1st day! At night the rooms were very cold, due to a draft: lower windowglass could be moved 1/4" first 3 nights were cold but ok. Last night was worst: we had to wake up @ 5am to return to the airport. @ midnight I was awaken by heavily dripping on my head! A huge leakage just above my bed.. a broken waterpipe or maybe a broken sewer??? Called frontdesk again: told about leakage and was put in hold! then connection was broken!!! called 'emergency' got same grumpy man explained the situation again and I was really not satisfactory with the service. We did get another room, same floor other wing: key didn't work: lock was broken :-(. We didn't care just wanted to sleep! As a gesture we did get a refund off 50% of parking fee, so finally a small sign of service. Unluckily we could sleep because of many yelling, shouting and knocking Koreamen @ 2am!! After a 3rd call to frontdesk finally security came. And @3:30am the korean next to our room decided to take a noisy bath with hard singing. As a gesture we did get a refund of the remaining valit parking fee. But that couldn't really compensate the lack of sleep and frustration. Check out was done by a young woman which was very friendly again. Summarized: + female staff is friendly and efficient - male staff is very grumpy and frustrating - appearantly renovated rooms do not exist. - toilet wasn't working properly - nights were cold - a leakage just above the headside of the bed - very noisy Korean men All of the above should not be affected by being an outdated hotel Would I recommend this hotel: definately NOT Would I ever return: hell no!

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: mtlv
Reviews.Content: Decent place, great location. Showing it's age a bit. Shower was horrendous, minimal pressure. (a great shower can go a long way for travelers). Star bucks downstairs is a bonus. Old school 27 inch TV. Staff were pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Just to Sleep”
Reviews.Author: AmoreBella
Reviews.Content: We went to LA for the sights,the hotel was just for resting at the end of the day...it basically did just that. There was a Starbucks every morning for coffee,many resturants around the area...Add $22 a day for parking....a little steep... Rooms were small and seemed old/dated..beds were comfortable... If its at a good price and you don't mind an older hotel...go for it...

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: Filmer_U
Reviews.Content: Very good service and friendly front desk staff. Any question or wish has been taken care and was solved immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: chicagobeenz
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have asked for a better location and better price. The hotel is minutes away from every place that I needed to go visit.
