The front desk and Concierge were very helpful with directions and recommendations for dinner. A young lady, named Tiffany, was very attentive to my needs and was always so pleasant to deal with. The service is what makes or breaks an establishment and the staff here definitely made the cut! Thanks for making my trip enjoyable and worthwhile!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but service needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: MNTraveler4613
Reviews.Content: Just returned from California and stayed at the Wilshire. The rate was great and it was close to a lot of things. Was a quick metro bus ride to Santa Monica Blvd, Beverly Hills, etc. The hotel is starting to show its age. Bathroom door didn't close without a good push. Beds were hard. Biggest complaint was the service. We asked about a train to take us to Pasadina. The front desk said there wasn't one. By the grace of some nice gals overhearing our conversation, gave us a ride into Pasadina because they rented a car, saving us a $75 cab fee. Once in Pasadina, found out there IS a train that drops off right across the street from the hotel! We used that for the ride back. It is very nice. After a long day, decided to grab a bite at the hotel restaurant. Waited 35 minutes for food...others were waiting a long wait as well. Bartender up and left......mystery where she went. We left and walked across the street to a Hardees.

Reviews.Title: “Bland, depressing rooms - site pictures deceiving!”
Reviews.Author: achx2
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 nights, stayed 1. The lobby is OK but the hallways/rooms are outdated, 70s-looking, bland and depressing, not in the old-style charm way! The mattresses for both beds were thin, cheap, uncomfortable and sagged in the middle. This hotel has to be 3-star on location only because the hotel itself is not worth the price. The staff were friendly at checkin/out and in the restaurant. It has valet parking (with daily fee) with unlimited checkout of your vehicle. Did have a view of the Hollywood sign but over rundown looking roofs and alleyways.

Reviews.Title: “BE WARNED! Photos look nothing like the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sunstarvedcanadian
Reviews.Content: I booked our trip through "Book it. com" and looked at the photos and thought this place looked really nice. I paid extra for a room with a view of the Hollywood sign, thinking that it would be a view like the photo on the "Book It " website. Well, I don't know where they took the photo from but it was definately not from that hotel. The Hollywood sign was visible but it was way off in the distance. The photo of the room was certainly not the same hotel. The lobby was very nice as expected, Trip Advisor comments did say this was true. The negative reviews on Trip Advisor are very accurate regarding the condition of the elevators, hallways, and rooms. Rooms are very dated and light switches are grimy. Sheets were nice but beds were saggy and over worn. The best thing I could say about the hotel is that its location near the subway is great and very easy to use. Would I stay here again? Probably, only because I only slept there, and was out all day so I didn't have to look at the room much. I have stayed in worse hotels. As far as noise goes, the rooms facing the Hollywood hills are the least noisy because they do not face the busy street. Oh, just a tip... if using the concierge to get a Taxi, call your own, it will cost you half as much! They have their own driving service which was a bit expensive for our budget. Let's face it, if I wanted to spend more money I would have stayed at a nicer hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: b00jum
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with great dining either in te Hotel or in Puck,s with friendly helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and felt safe.”
Reviews.Author: atiras77
Reviews.Content: Front desk employee Mr. Damian Cortez was my primary contact. Cortez was impeccably dressed, hair - nails, disposition was enthusiastic to please and ensure my comfort. All staff were polite. The room was comfortable and clean. I would recommend this place for anyone. Many foreign clientele from different continents. Large Korean culture as hotel is located in KoreaTown. I would definately stay there again. You will like it. Fast food and Korean are plentiful, within walking distance. You do have to pay extra for auto park.

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: flc4
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay at the wilshire plaza hotel as part of a package through an agent without reading any reviews, and once reading reviews here were nervous about the Los Angeles leg of our trip! On arriving at the Wilshire plaza after travelling for 22hours we were actually pleasently surprised! Ok it wasnt the best hotel i've stayed in, and could do with some re decoration but it was clean, comfortable and pretty well located for exploring LA. The staff we encountered were friendly and with their help we were able to explore LA on public transport (Metro and buses) from the doorstep of the hotel! For the price of this hotel in los angeles, i think perhaps people need to adjust their expectations or increase their budget!

Reviews.Title: “Wished I hadn't stayed here.”
Reviews.Author: Wollongong2515
Reviews.Content: The lobby is nice, staff ok but room was yuck especially the bathroom - really old & mouldy, wardrobe door didn't work. Just yuck. I left some items behind in the room & have been trying to claim them however hotel has not been helpful at all. Obviously my stuff was kept by staff or house keeping.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed at in LA - but noisy traffic”
Reviews.Author: LodgerFromChicago
Reviews.Content: Thinking back on over 10 low-budget trips to LA in the past decade, this is one of the best LA hotels I've ever stayed in. I visited the Wilshire for 2 nights during Halloween weekend. I always sleep cheap, and in past LA visits, I've stayed at Hollywood Motel 8 on Western, the Saharan on Sunset, the Comfort Inn at the Beverly Red Line subway stop, and other motels of the sort. So, for me, the Wilshire Plaza was more opulent than my other LA hotel stays. The 11th floor (out of 12) room was large and comfortable. But the traffic sounded like it was just outside the window. The many dozens of rooms facing Wilshire are in a traffic canyon - and the noise richochets off other buildings directly into your bed. As I travel with earplugs, I remained in the room. The high floors opposite the street have excellent views of Griffith Observatory, the Hollywood letters, and several blocks of LA. Enjoy the free apples in the 11th floor fitness room. Awesome location at the Normandie Red Line subway stop.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an UPGRADE!”
Reviews.Author: HappyVacationor
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs alot of work, rooms are very old with water stains all over the ceilings and carpets.. Closet doors do not open, It is a good thing we did not need to spend alot of time in our room, not very pleasant. After complaining about our room they then gave us another one facing the Hollywood Sign..Which was so much better. Still not the best kept room.The front desk staff was very nice and very helpful...We only ate in the hotel once for breakfast on day 1.. Service was not very good.... It was almost like they were doing us a favor by serving us.. Shocking. The greatest thing about this hotel was the Starbucks in the lobby...Great coffee BUT we never got a smile from the person who was working there...Once again I was shocked....Also the Metro station was right across the street.. That was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay for the value”
Reviews.Author: deejay07
Reviews.Content: The Wilshire Hotel is centrally located in Los Angeles, near downtown and many other attractions. Although the hotel is in the process of being renovated, and i believe it has lots of character in its current condition, I enjoyed my stay and the staff was very pleasant and accomodating, especially Ms. Zimmer.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump...stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Gypsee_44
Reviews.Content: My company put me here because it is centrally located to several places I was working for a week. The hotel is in Korea town, a very congested area, far from the interstates with not much else around. I started in a room on the 12th floor of the hotel over a very busy interestion with non stop traffic, even on the 12th floor the noise was like sitting on the curb. Then moved to the other side away from the traffic, which did have a nice view of Hollywood Hills. Both rooms were gross and smelled musty. The A/C didn't work well. The beds were very hard, like sleeping on a slab. The curtains and chair in the rooms were dirly and dingy black from age, the wall paper was peeling from the walls, the sink in the bathroom leaked all over counter and the carpet is nasty and paper thin. The $18.00 breakfast buffet in "Tulips", the hotel resturarnt, was cold and gross, cold eggs, hard pancakes, and the smell from the chafer with bacon was enough to turn your stomach . I waited almost an hour two separate nights for room service to bring up cold food and a third night for melted ice cream. The hotel advertised internet access, but I was only able to get internet access in my room one day of my six day stay. The staff was friendly enough, until I expressed my dissatifaction with the food service, then they were pretty much indifferent. I've stayed in nicer Super 8's. If it hadn't been for the fact I was gone most of the day and didn't really have the time, I would of changed hotels. No way would I waste my money on this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Disastrous”
Reviews.Author: FaFlan
Reviews.Content: We changed room 3 times in 2 days and still could not rest. The first room was a loud bang on the avenue, the second room was behind the elevator and had no hot water. Surprisingly the third room with the air conditioning was broken ... a horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “only if your on a low budget”
Reviews.Author: AtriaMantra
Reviews.Content: I traveled to the Wilshire Hotel Plaza with some friends to see LA and travel the coast. The Hotel was an exact reflection of LA. Dirty, musty, old, basic english,... but you can get a decent coffee in the lobby,... in a lot of reviews ive read i have noticed people mentioning the "nice and clean lobby" but what good is a lobby unless you are going to sleep there. The rooms are not nice at all, the TV is small and the sheets dont fit the bed, there was a drop of blood dried up on one of the beds in my room. The view, was not of the Hollywood hills like it said but more of the Carl's Jr. across the street,.... altho it seemed like the general location of this hotel was somewhat safe in Korea town, i wouldn't stay there again, in the wilshire or Korea town, simply because its not a good location for travelers from the US unless you are korean. The elevators jammed up on my girlfriend and I for 15 minutes, the key to my room worked only on the 20th try, I was just incredibly happy to get out of this Hotel. As for the staff, they were extremely nice, giving there working conditions, the valet staff was underpaid and was prompt on mentioning it to acquire tips. The girl who checked me in was very very nice and managed to wave whenever i walked thru the lobby. So to ensure that the staff stay employed i will say, only stay if your hurting for money. 1 or 2 hundred on your priceline packages will be worth it trust me.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: LOIRE1282
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Wilshire Los Angeles for 3 nights, had a great stay lovely breakfast, nice staff, location ok but felt that there was nothing much to do nearby. Would recomend and next time in Los Angeles would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: KNelly
Reviews.Content: very good hotel - very clean and staff were friendly and helpful. I loved the location it was easy to get around LA and the staff helped with all travelling queries we had. Overall very good and I woudl definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby is gorgeous but rooms are cheap...”
Reviews.Author: JennaBond007
Reviews.Content: Lobby is gorgeous but rooms are cheap. Our room was just "okay". There was hair on our bed, burn marks in our sheets, and the room just felt very cheap. The only reason we went with this hotel was because of an Internet deal. I would not recommend this hotel. The front desk guys were not very friendly or kind and the parking is too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Business Luncheon”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler2012
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to thank you and your Wilshire Plaza Hotel staff again for making our luncheon such a success. Everybody had a great time, the food was wonderful, the room was perfect and the audio and visual equipment worked flawlessly. The location is centrally located in the Wilshire Center District of Los Angeles. The Purple line Metro Rail train is just across the street and being that the hotel is on Wilshire Blvd. and Normandie Ave. made it very easy for everyone to find. Thank you for all your hard work. We will be sure to consider you and the Wilshire Plaza Hotel for all our future events.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in L.A.”
Reviews.Author: Bobo155019
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at The Wilshire Hotel Los Angeles in the heart of Korean Town, and we had a great time! The front desk staff was so awesome and friendly. We had a few issues with our room keys not working but front desk handled that promptly. The room was ok-standard room. We enjoyed spending time in the pool and eating at the Terrace Restaurant. We stayed for 5 days, spent a few nights at the Lobby Lounge for Happy Hour...I have to say overall, even though the hotel itself could use a few upgrades here and there, the staff was amazing and really went above and beyond. Next time we come to LA we will definitely stay at The Wilshire Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: crtd
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with this hotel. The rugs are flithy. I won't walk on them without shoes. The linens on the beds are old and slide off the bed. I got bit by some kind of bug during the night (flea?). Rundown. The lobby is very nice, but deceiving, considering the state of the rooms. I won't stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff at the Wilshire Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nick0001
Reviews.Content: Just want to say we had an Exceptional stay at the Wilshire Hotel. The Staff here are great. Bending over backwards to assist you in any way they can. Nice clean rooms, Good Food. I would highly recommend this hotel. Nick Candy

Reviews.Title: “Yuck! Don't even consider it!”
Reviews.Author: CApoolrat
Reviews.Content: The only nice thing about the Wilshire Plaza hotel is the misconceiving lobby. The rooms were absolutely horrendous. The carpet in the room was so stained and filthy that we had to keep shoes on at all times! Stains on the ceiling (I'll assume from water damage from higher floors, I hope). Very outdated, worn and ugly bathroom, hallways, elevators, conference rooms, etc. Comforters on the beds were stained, snagged and disgusting. The waitstaff in the bar area was aloof and snooty and had no urgency toward customer service. But that's just the tip of the iceberg. During our stay, the entire hospitality staff left their positions to join in a protest against the hotel leaving us with no service at all! We rreceived NO clean towels, NO room straightening or tidying, NO trash pickup!! We were there for a dance conference and apparently a glass had been broken in the room where the students were dancing. Housekeeping failed to clean up the glass adequately resulting in a few girls being cut by the glass either on their hands or feet!! WOW! I approached the front desk about the protest and how intimidating it was for the guests not to mention the inconvenience it placed on all of us. I was not even offered an apology just an excuse. Do yourself a huge favor, do NOT book a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “MOTEL HELL”
Reviews.Author: AMBSongbird
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel August 10th, 11th & 12th for a WCE Dance Convention with our high school dance team and it was truly horrible! The lobby is very pretty and inviting but deceiving of what is yet to come when you venture to your room! The carpets were stained, wallpaper peeling off, dank and musty smelling, the vending machines were empty on all floors I ventured to and the ice machines I went to on the 3rd and 4th and 5th floor were empty, the gym hours indicated in the in-room booklet say they are open 24 hours...the sign on the door of the gym says open 6am-9pm and the front desk told me they open at 8:30am (I was never able to get in) and then on another day the front desk rep told me the gym is closed because the hotel room below the gym was occupied and the use of the gym would disturb the guest...ok continuing on...a few of the people in my dance group were unable to get the maids to clean their room and my room was not left clean towels and then the maids/some service crew went on strike marching in front of and blocking the entrance to the hotel...they carried signs and yelled at us with bullhorns "DON'T CHECK IN! CHECK OUT! SHAME ON YOU!" Needless to say our children were uncomfortable going out of the hotel for food when on a dance break...the ballroom the dancers were in had shattered glass on and in the carpet resulting in cuts to the feet of our dancers!!!!! This place is HORRIBLE! One guest told me I needed to go down to the garage to look at how the valet parked my car (Honda Accord Coupe)...into the wall!!!! I walked into the garage and yes, my new car had been parked back in and was against the wall. I asked for the valet manager who was very nice when he told me, "It is very safe here." I told him I wasn't concerned over safety but over damage to my new car...he observed the bad park job and asked, "Do you want me to park it into a bigger space?" I told him, "No, just please pull it forward." He did move it forward. The valet crew was nice about allowing you to visit your car to load baggage into for check out. When several of us asked for a credit, some of us were credited the $22.00 per day parking fee as a gesture while others were only give a one day parking credit. Please drive a little further to a more quality facility. There were nice and casual restaurants across from the hotel such as "Wasabi - Japanese Noodle House" and "O'Mamamia" and TOGO's and McDonalds.

Reviews.Title: “A really bad experience - avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: orhankhopar
Reviews.Content: We booked accomodation at Wilshire Plaza hotel through EasyClick website, booking one standard room. Looking at hotel's website we saw pleasantly looking rooms, refurbished and modern. We arrived at hotel in a car - shock one - 22 USD per night for valet parking (Easyclick's description mentioned complimentary parking). Our room was old, with dirty floor, stained curtains, old/noisy bad, air-conditioning device, bathroom was horrible. We immediately complained and asked to speak with the manager. They told us that they have a fairly small set of refurbished rooms (the ones shown on the website), which are given based on first-come-first-server principle. They also tried to upsell us to an Executive Suite for additional 189 USD/night. The only good thing about this hotel was a free Internet access. Compare attached photos with room photos on hotel's official website.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value hotel next to subway stop”
Reviews.Author: pmacker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four days and any irish/uk traveller would be more than happy with this place. The neighbourhood felt safe and it directly facing a subway stop and there were plenty of places to eat too. Cant believe all the negitive comments, its cheap, safe and clean

Reviews.Title: “Got a great deal and had a view of the Hollywood Sign”
Reviews.Author: AussieLK
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal - $110 AUD per night for a deluxe king room with a view to the Hollywood sign. When paying this little in LA the location was never going to be great, but we had the token view of the sign which was nice. The room was fine, what we expected at this price. Not brand new but kept nice enough, comfy enough bed. Staff were nice. Not many restaurants around, not that were open anyway. Caught the bus to Santa Monica - easy done, but would probably get a taxi next time. We were only there for 2 nights / 1 day. We had a tour planned for the whole day and they picked us up from the hotel and dropped us back, so the location wasn't too much of a problem. If you want to be around Santa Monica / Malibu etc, prepare to pay. If you're doing tours and things and don't need to be around those areas then this location is fine and this hotel is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Best and most understanding Hotel Staff and Service”
Reviews.Author: hamy2tree
Reviews.Content: Yesterday 29 July 2010 has got to be one of the worse nights ever. I have a 25 hour flight to include 1-2 hr layovers in two U.S. states. The weather has delayed both my domestic flights from DCA - ORD and ORD- LAX ultimately resulting in me missing my International Flight to SYD (Sydney, Australia). It's 2AM and Customer Service at LAX tells me that all hotels are booked. They let me call my boyfriend who said "give me ten minutes I will find you a hotel." Customer Service told me shortly thereafter they didn't have ten minutes and they were closing so then I had to find a pay phone. At this point I was exhausted. Finally my boyfriend gave me the address to Wilshire Hotel. He booked the hotel for July 30-31. Check in time was at 3 PM. The staff was so friendly and understanding of my situation when I arrived at 4:30AM. They found me a room and worked out the financial situation with my boyfriend since he bought the ticket through a third party (Expedia.com). Needless to say, the Wilshire Hotel has the best and most understanding Hotel Staff and Service I have ever experienced. The rooms are in excellent condition. The only reason I gave Wilshire hotel four stars instead of five for location is because it is about 20 minutes away from LAX. It is possible to arrange a shuttle though. It cost somewhere around $16.00 each way. And is definitely worth the travel! On a positive note, there many food both fast and sit-down restaurants nearby as well as a internet cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: TheatreloverFlorida
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ll be honest. I was a little concerned about this hotel after reading some of the reviews. It was clear that this was a love it or hate it kind of place based on the fact that only part of the hotel is renovated. I booked the 4 day/3 night package via Priceline which included airfare from Florida to LA for just under $600 total. So considering that airfare by itself would have been about that had I booked separately, I basically got the hotel portion of the package for next to nothing. I was still a bit nervous so I sent a message to one of the more positive reviewers and asked if they would mind telling me the room number that they stayed in, which they kindly provided. I then called the hotel and requested that specific room for my reservation. I arrived at the hotel around 1pm after traveling since 5am. The check in was quick and painless with the exception of the room I requested not being available due to the current guest occupying that particular room extending their stay. I was given an identical room on the 11th floor, the only difference being that it was a street facing room as opposed to a rear facing room. The room was great for what I needed it for. The bed, while the comforter seemed a bit outdated, was very comfortable and the sheets were soft. Some people have posted issues with street noise, but I did not have a problem with this the 3 nights I was there. Perhaps because I was on one of the upper floors. The bathroom was small, but clean and included a blow dryer. Some reviewers have mentioned a problem with the hot water running out, but I did not experience this issue. Also, some reviewers have mentioned problems with the room being too hot. Perhaps itâ€™s because Iâ€™m from Florida and have a higher tolerance for warm temps, but I found the roomâ€™s temperature to be quite pleasant and only messed with the thermostat once and that was when I first got there. The internet, while free was VERY slow. I was in town to cover the Premiere of the movie Inception for an entertainment blog, so being able to upload pictures was a big deal and I had A LOT of trouble with this. The TV worked fine and had plenty of channels to choose from. I did not rent a car for this trip as the idea of driving in LA freaks me out, so the fact that the Metro was directly across the street was very convenient. It got me into the heart of Hollywood in 20 minutes. There seemed to be plenty of fast food and dining choices around the hotel, but I ended up eating a lot of room service. It was a little inconvenient that they stopped serving at 10pm. Also, the menu in the room is not current. One time I called down to room service and the phone just rang and rang and rang. When I called the front desk to ask if they were open, they said yes, but they were probably just really busy. The lady attempted to transfer me back to room service, but accidently hung up on me. I finally got through after 30 minutes of trying. There is a $30 dollar per day hold that is placed on your card, which may not be a big deal if youâ€™re using a credit card but could create some issues if youâ€™re using a debit card. And charges made to room service arenâ€™t deducted from that hold â€“ it is charged separately, which added additional unforeseen charges. Just a heads up for those traveling on a budget. There is a small gift store downstairs that serves a limited selection of snacks and soft drinks and various sundry items, but it is quite expensive, so I would recommend making the 10 minute walk down Wilshire to the CVS and picking up any snack items you might need. Overall, it was a great stay. As long as you know what youâ€™re getting ahead of time and are not expecting more than what youâ€™re paying for you should have no problems. Also, I am a female who stayed there alone and felt safe the entire time which counts for a lot in my book. I am returning next month and will definitely stay there again. A quick note about the airport shuttles. DO NOT use Shuttle Express. This is the most unprofessional outfit I have EVER dealt with and they attempted to get me to pay twice. The driver was unbelievably rude and insulting after I presented my proof of payment and refused to pay again. This was AFTER I had given him a generous tip. However, I used Prime Shuttle for my return to the airport and they were fantastic and only cost $22.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is awesome but hotel is old and not very clean.”
Reviews.Author: ctalbot
Reviews.Content: We stayed about 5 days and 6 nights at the Wilshire @3515 Wilshire Blvd. Pro's: Staff was the friendliest and most helpful hotel staff I have ever met. The location was close enough to the airport and other sites in L.A. Con's: Hotel was very outdated. Room curtains were badly stained. The hotel rugs were badly stained. Comforters (which I usually don't use seemed dusty and were so old the print looked like a 60's motif. The toilet stopped up (3) times but maintenance promptly came up and housekeeping came after to clean up. Young adults use the hotel as a meeting place to have loud party's in the rooms. We had to have our room moved. Like most hotels one of their restaurants (The Tulip) was too expensive and we were just having breakfast. And one last thing valet must park your car for about $22 a night.

Reviews.Title: “It all depends on what you want...”
Reviews.Author: JRLAW
Reviews.Content: It's important to begin by saying that I booked my one night stay through Hotwire and paid a rate of $59.00. First, the pros: cheap rate for a hotel within 15 minutes of Downtown and USC; impressive entrance and lobby; friendly car valet service; good front desk staff; business center with free printing of airline boarding passes; lots of Asian and other fast food restaurants just outside the hotel; across from Metro subway station; restaurant and coffee kiosk on property, the latter serving Starbucks; no problem accessing 3G from my room; and hairdryer in bathroom and iron in closet. Second, the cons: stains on carpet; window not well sound insulated; old lamp fixtures; no in-room safe; a/c difficult to regulate; and no bowed curtain rod in shower. So, here's my recommendation about the Wilshire Hotel: if you want to save money in Los Angeles, this is an okay deal. I assume that the quality of room I received was related to my using Hotwire. From other posts about this hotel, it does appear there are better, newly renovated rooms. I don't what the rate for those are, but you should probably check and you still might get a pretty good deal. If you're a business traveler on a budget, I'd recommend a Hampton Inn or a Courtyard, but because neither of those are located in Downtown Los Angeles, you'd have to do more driving than you might like. You'd also be paying a lot more than $59.00 for the standard accomodations that business travelers expect. As I checked out, I noticed a lot of international travelers in the lobby, young and old. It almost felt like a hostel. I'm sure that the low rates appeal to these travelers and that they might not worry about some of the room details that a business traveler would. Finally, I went to Hotwire needing an inexpensive property that was close to Little Tokyo and USC. Hotwire described this unnamed hotel as "near USC." So, I thought for sure that I was getting a great rate at the Radisson Midtown-USC, which is right across the street from the University and is normally way overpriced. I was surprised and disapppointed when I clicked "select" and discovered that I was paying for a hotel that really is not "near USC." You always take your chances, I guess, with sites like Hotwire and Priceline. Anyway, to sum up, I didn't mind paying only $59.00 for a room for one night at the Wilshire Hotel. For future business travel to Los Angeles, I'll stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a Bad place to stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: therealstoryCANADA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel from June 21 to June 27th. We got a great rate through Travel zoo,that included a 2 for 1 Buffet breakfast. When we first checked in I was very very Dissappointed in the room we were given. It was suppose to be a none smoking room,but the room smelled of smoke,various burns on the carpet, a musty smelling room. I immediately even before getting our luggage off the cart went to see the manager. I just told him the truth about the room and we were not going to stay 1 night in that room. The managers name was Keith,and very friendly and helpfull guy. He gave us the keys to another room on the 11th floor and asked my wife and I to see this room. Well what a difffence it was like night and day. The room was brand new,,new carpet, new TV set, nice furnishings.It looked like the room I saw on there website. I think they are going under a big renovation project and is going to take sometime to redo all the rooms. Once we got into our new room we found the staff very friendly all the way from the front desk to the restaraunt to the concierge. The Buffet breakfast was standard, and we did not have lunch there. It was only open for breakfast and lunch. The lobby in the bar had a supper menu. The Hotel itself was just on the edge of downtown area the koreatown district. There was a Dennys, and Macs and Subway and a big Pharmacy store within easy walking distance. The LA Metro system was right across the Street. For 5.00 all day pass made it very easy to go downtown, Hollywood, Universal, all wihtin 15 mins to all locations. Also a great busline brought you downtown very easy. The true bottom line was that this hotel was well worth the money compared to the downtown hotels. We saved over 400.00 compared to the Sheraton or downtown Marriott. The bathrooms were a bit small but who is going to hangout in there bathroom all day,lol the only other small problem was they missed 1 wakeup call and I was up anyways so no damage done. They gave us 2 free coup[ons for the Buffet breakfast. That mistake did not happen again. They also have tours you can book right at the hotel for all kinds of places. and the 55.00 Lincoln towncare ride to LAX was worth every penny compared to the 35.00 Super Shuttle from LAX we took to the hotel. I hope this honest review will help people decide if they want to stay at this hotel. For the service and the price and the managment willing to work with you I would stay here again. Also free Wireless internet was a bonus!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lobby great, rooms... not so much”
Reviews.Author: RickAndFamily
Reviews.Content: Had high hopes when we walked into the lobby. The place looked nice and very clean. Unfortunately, we then entered our room. Old carpet that needs to be stretched out, smelled like it used to be a smoking room, moldy shower/bathroom. However, it was cheap :) Asked for another pillow and was told "the hotel is out of pillows".

Reviews.Title: “Choose Some Place Else”
Reviews.Author: dianaathena
Reviews.Content: I thought this would be a nicer hotel than it is. For starters, two of their restaurants are closed down...one is now only open for breakfast and lunch and the lounge is the only place open for dinner, which is pricey and mediocre. There was an extensive room service menu, however when I called to place an order I was informed that the menu in the room was no longer valid as of a month ago and half the items on the menu were discontinued, including the ones I was trying to order. The rooms ARE climate controlled for air-conditioning as well as the showers being timer controlled for heat...to conserve water. You get hot water for no more than 5 minutes. The beds are hard and the bedding is very scratchy. This hotel has not been updated at all. Everywhere from here is at least a 20-35.00 cab ride each way so I would advice that unless you drove, to stay much closer to the tourist destinations of your choice. All in all, for under 100.00 a night its a decent deal, but I really was expecting more of the hotel based on its website and reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Yuo can sleep but not stay”
Reviews.Author: titus086
Reviews.Content: The carpet in the common areas and rooms need a facelift as they give the hotel the appearance of being old and run down. Room smell bad. Each odor in the room. Breakfast was good and did not include a versatile room hiuntaan.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place”
Reviews.Author: Hamed999
Reviews.Content: I can not believe that everything in this hotel including room key, toilet, bed, view, ....are abnormal exactly like an old motel in a small city rather than be a hotel in Los Angeles. The location is far from everything either downtown, convention center and ...on the other hand, the price while no specific service you have is expensive for this kind of hotel and room. Within my travel in united state, it was the worst hotel compared to all other hotels which i stayed there, therefore i never recommend this hotel. Go and see yourself

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: garcia918
Reviews.Content: We booked this room through the hotels direct website. All the photos are completely misleading. The rooms are outdated, small, have horrible lighting and rock hard beds. We have had better quality rooms at Motel 6. Expect "views" to be of neighboring apartment buildings or businesses. The valet staff was great, to bad the rest of the hotel wasnt. We were shown other rooms besides the one we had been checked into and all were the same. We left the hotel completely dissapointed and ended up driving home the same night.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have stayed in over 20 years”
Reviews.Author: RBryan1011
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Travelzoo and I can tell you as a business traveler that stays in over 100 hotels all around the world this is the worst hotel I have stayed in over the last 25 years of business travel. The hotel is a "dump" with old rooms and the heater in the room did not work and we were offered a space heater which I refused to use in this "matchbox". The executive staff of the hotel was very inattentive and did not care about the complaints. The linens, bedding and towels were scary to use. The hotel guest were a very "seedy" clientele along with the usual Europeans and Asian airline staffs who obviously do not know quality hotels. This place has a good location but is purely horrible. I cannot understand why anyone in their right mind would even consider staying in this hotel unless the rooms were under $75.00-USD per night. With the USD to Euro conversion I can understand why European tourist stay at this hotel. I also have to expect that the airlines that have a contract with this hotel pay $50-USD or less per night because it cannot be worth more than that. If you believe this is a 4 or 5 star hotel as I have read in some of the other reviews I have an island in Manhattan that I will sell you for 80 million dollars as a bargain. Please get real.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Customer Servic e”
Reviews.Author: Newlyweds11ohio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here for our honeymoon. The hotel was beautiful. We stayed in the honeymoon suite and it was great. Very clean, very spacious and it felt like home away from home! The front desk staff was very friendly and accomodated all of our needs and more. The prices are affordable and well worth it. The valet guys were great too. Our overall visit was one of the best we have had thus far. I highly reccomend staying at this hotel. :-) The Newlyweds!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, clean, great room”
Reviews.Author: SazzySabrine
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend as I needed a hotel in LA due having surgery in Beverly Hills. The hotel was pretty cheap at only Â£50 a night for both of us. The reception was very organised and we were checked in quickly. Our room was very very clean with no complaints. I had to spend alot of time in the hotel room to recover, and it was a great place to relax with everything I needed. The room was huge, with loads of space and a huge double bed which was very comfortable and clean. Had the TV handy and phone in the room with room service. Also had an ice machine on the floor which was really handy. The bathroom was also very clean and the shower was good. Cool view onto Wilshire Blvd. Location from Hollywood and Beverly hills was quite far, but all day travel cost $5 and a bus that ran very frequently and 24 hrs was literally outside the hotel and took about 30mins to get there. The metro was also right across the street and was easily to get around with. Just wanted to leave this review as I have seen lots of negative comments and I feel I have left an honest review and would definatly reccommend it. Yeah its a little dated, like not modern or anything, but the decor is still nice and very comfy!There is noise from the traffic as its on a mainstream road but its not really an issue. Also the area is very safe I thought, and there is a really cheap and nice chinese restaurasnt across the street called wasabi i think!I think some people are too fussy, this place is great for the price, and the location is pretty good too. In context of this hotels price and star rating I thought it was fab!

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL EXPERIENCE I HAD”
Reviews.Author: vjames90
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Wilshire Plaza Hotel multiple times and each time I continue to have an outstanding experience. The manager, Vic, was very kind and understandable and gave us complimentary breakfast and parking. The entire staff was friendly, warm and helpful. The rooms were beautiful and room service absolutely delicious! I would NEVER stay anywhere else when in LA!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable enough but not plush”
Reviews.Author: cattynet
Reviews.Content: I went to LA in January after a business trip to Carlsbad. The Wilshire Plaza Hotel was good value (booked through hotel website) but it's nothing special... it's the old Radisson so you can tell the building and facilities are old. Location is good though, especially if you don't have a car, as there is a Metro station right outside.

Reviews.Title: “The Whilshir Plaza”
Reviews.Author: KatyaKatya
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wilshire Plaza 2 months ago. It was an alright 3 star hotel, even better than most of the 3 stars I have stayed at. Though it was nothing special, I would recommend it to a friend. I also suggest taking a look at easyclicktravel.com - wilshire plaza was alot cheaper there than any of the other sites I was looking at. For LA overall, I would recommend taking the time to do shopping!

Reviews.Title: “my weekend at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: donvman
Reviews.Content: yes my name is Don V. Taylor, i visited with my girlfriend and her girls to this hotel to attend a coronation from my organization the imperial court of Los Angeles thanksgiving weekend. what was to be a wonderful weekend at this hotel almost turned into a nightmare before it even got started. our organization has been doing business with this hotel for years prior that it was the raddisson hotel which we with them as well. this was the first year that i had issues i wanted to discuss i dont know how much room to explain all this here i will send a personal letter to the hotel but what made my weekend nice had a wonderful frone end mgr. name Vic Jurado he is a outstanding individual that needs to reccomended for a job well done and a higher position he solved a few of my probs with the hotel from the valet service which is terrible there and accomendated my rooms with perfection and professionalism i had a double room and a jr suite for the weekend he made that happen when i arrived to make it easy for us i had paid for my rooms a week in advance and made it easy to give us the suite for the weekend since all costs were paid in full anyway the valet is horrible and the rooms need ammenties like at least microwaves and refridgerators to complete a customer stay at the hotel so if they want to bring things back like food from a resturant to heat up or store it would be nice well i have more to say but to say mr Vic Jurado is number one mgr and hope he will be recognized by his peers and upper management in his hotel organization thank you......

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, fabulous hospitality, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Brad42
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times over the past 9 years. While the facility and staff have been through some difficult times, the staff has always maintained the highest standard of professionalism and courtesy. It is the staff who make the Plaza such a pleasant experience: from the parking attendants to the front desk staff, bellmen, housekeeping, and food service employees. Food service in the restaurant and lobby bar is excellent and reasonably priced. I am pleased to see that improvements to the physical environment are beginning to bring the Plaza back toward its former elegance and charm. I will be returning regularly during the years ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Despite some awful reviews, my friend and I had a great experience with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fiona3206
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked the Wilshire Plaza because we got a great deal - it was so cheap! Then, we read all the reviews and started to panic that we were in for an awful experience! However, we couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised! The hotel was, in our opinion, fantastic! We were greeted with a friendly, speedy check in. Yes we had to leave a credit card details incase we used the phone etc but isn't this standard for all hotels? Then we had someone take our bags to our room who refused to take a tip from us as he said we were tired and it was no problem at all! He also said that if we were not happy with our view that we could notify reception and get a view of the Hollywood sign. Room was spacious, bright and clean. Room was a little noisy from traffic on the street but what do you expect in a busy area? Concierge extremely helpful and friendly. We spent 6 nights here and had no complaints. LA is a difficult area to get around without a car, but this was in a great location as it is right across the street from the Wilshire/Normandy subway. This bargain hotel exceeded all our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but you have to go by car to the attractions”
Reviews.Author: ViviJeff
Reviews.Content: I guess once in LA, is dificult to move without a car. This hotel is comfortable but is hard to find a place to park and inside the hotel is too expensive. There are some cafes and restaurants nearby. It's a central zone.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can...everything you read here is true”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaTrvlbug
Reviews.Content: This place was a dump, plain and simple. I've seen Motel 6 hotels that are so much nicer than this one. Ok, this place has a lobby that isn't too bad, but if you want to sleep and not worry about stained bedspreads and cigarette burns all over the place you need to avoid this hotel. Our group of business colleagues are ready to throw our planner over the roof rails because of this decision. The items to expect are as follows: 1. Noisy rooms (stay on side furthest away from Wilshire Blvd. unless you like horns and sirens and car noise) 2. Curtains that don't close all the way (expect to get up with the sun) 3. Cigarette burns/smell - how is this place still here with all the potential fires from people extinguishing their cigarettes on the floors? 4. Broken bathroom tiles 5. Poor wireless access in rooms - go to lobby for sending emails 6. No heat - had to ask for a space heater for my room because the HVAC doesn't work 7. Hard as a rock bed and pillows gave me a stiff neck in the middle of the night 8. Paint/wallpaper peeling off the walls in the bathroom 9. No food options at night...everything was closed nearby and no vending machines in the lobby to grab a snack after arriving late the night of check-in 10. Workout "room" was more of a closet with a couple machines 11. Ripped seats at the desk, use a towel to sit in those things In these days of discounted rooms, this should be a $50/night hotel based on the condition. I've stayed at 4 star hotels in the area recently for the same price that we paid and had much better experiences. Just avoid this place all togetther.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Sarabarbosa41
Reviews.Content: We stayed there two nights but we would never come back. We found the room and carpets really dirty and I do think that the owners of this place should give more attention to housekeeping. Besides it was very noisy - we were woken up really early by the street noise. However, the breakfast was nice.

Reviews.Title: “I love L.A. and this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tamerabra
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, not bad location, metro across the street, starbuck s in hotel, juice bar and coffee across the street. Easy to get to airport, $1.55 on metro and easy to get to Santa Monica and swam in the ocean , one city bus for $1.25. Absolutely good value for the rate I paid which was really cheap. Will come again. Loved the pool area and fountain, very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you have low expectations”
Reviews.Author: Shayd_Lady
Reviews.Content: As my partner and I did not want to stay in the middle of Hollywood, we thought the Wilshire Plaza would be a great location & fairly priced. This turned out to be correct as Hollywood was only a few short Metro stops away. However, thats where the positivety of our stay here ends. The customer service provided by the staff at the front desk was average, the concierge forever seems to be on a break, the bar man in the lobby bar give the impression he'd rather be anywhere but there, which is a shame as the lobby itself was a lot cooler to sit in than the room which was hot & stuffy. Understanding that this hotel was built in the late 70s, I expected it to be old, but not run down & falling to bits. Surely in the 30 years its been there, some sort of minor renovation could've taken place apart from changing the Raddison sign over the a Wilshire Plaza sign. Upon reaching the hallway of our floor, we were greeted with the smell of rotting garbage with take away containers or room service trays outside of a few doors - some of these still sitting there 2 days later! The room itself was tiny, old, dirty , smelt like cigarettes despite the fact it was a non smoking room & needed repairs. The room was so small that we barely had enough room to lay 2 suitcases out. Despite the fact we could hear the air conditioning growling away, we couldn't feel it. The window opened but, like the hallway, the air outside also smelt of rotting garbage. The view was lovely as we could see up to the Hollywood sign but as the room was so tiny, couldn't really sit & enjoy it. When we finally could get hold of a concierge, we asked him to organise transport to the airport for us at a specific time. He called half an hour earlier than we had asked & telling us that we were taking too long & the driver was waiting. When told we asked for transport at a specific time, not earlier, he just shrugged. I would not stay at this hotel again, not would I recommend it to anyone else. Whether youre paying a budget rate or top dollar, courteous, friendly service is always nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the right price”
Reviews.Author: vjl330
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights.We were on the 11th floor and I slept comfortably and heard nothing.Very convenient location to transit.True,the decor is circa 1984 and could use a renovation. But we paid less than 90 a night which is reasonable for an LA hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If I had a choice”
Reviews.Author: chas112
Reviews.Content: We booked online and "thought it was a deal", Location was okay didn't feel like it was anything special just like business as usual. Rooms are clean, beds comfortable. We had the room to the front on a lower floor........ could hear the roar of the roof top ,(Next Buliding)ac all night.,traffic horns and yelling,ambulances, screaming ladies, singing at the top of your lungs going back to your room @ 2 in the morning group. No choice about parking though .......pay 2 dollars an hour for metered parking if you can find a spot or pay 20.00 dollars for valet parking."No, you cannot park it yourself" which was under staffed while checking out. I guess the worst thing was the inside of my car smelled like a dumpster when they brought it back the next morning, so I wondered where they had parked it. Room service adds 16% and 2 dollars for delivery (ensure that tip boys)

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel but defnitly not as bad as made out on here..”
Reviews.Author: melbournegal9
Reviews.Content: When first pulling up at this hotel I was plesently suprised. I had imagined something absolutely horrible. The Lobby is of a good standard and check in was fine.. When given our rooms I was impressed. With a view facing Wilshire Bvld, Yes it was a little loud but nothing worth loosing sleep over. Clean sheets, and towels, and spacious - which is hard to find in US hotels. Ice machine which was located close by was handy.Yes, it could do with a renovation but it was defnitly not what people make it out to be. We were happy with the position - 3 stops to hollywood, which took approx 6 minutes. $14 cab ride from Hollywood BVLD. Train station opposite hotel, and bus out the front taking any tourist to LA anywhere they would need to go.. so PERFECT LOCATION. The only dispute I would have to mention would be the night manager - a friend of ours was robbed in las vegas and needed to use the phone line, as we had booked the room through expedia there was no credit card down on the room.. which is quite stupid to be honest but we were not asked.. he needed to call various banks, insurance co etc, and ran up a $258 phone bill in 50 minutes.. the night manager then refused to let us back into our room until it had been paid.. I explained how we needed access into the room to get our keycard to take cash out..but after yelling and being extreamly rude to me personally - when it was not me who ran up the bill - a friend covered the cost. I have never felt so disgusted in the way a manager has spoken to a guest - especially when he should not have opened the phone line up ( under any circumstances) without a credit card. Im sure he did not follow any management guidelines there. Apart from that I would stay here again, but I will be honest the whole situation over the phoneline made me feel very upset.

Reviews.Title: “Run don't walk from this hotel - Need repair badly”
Reviews.Author: dmoney2222
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights and will never go back again. Here is a hint. The Los Angeles Health Department shut down the hotel's pool.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but spacious.”
Reviews.Author: TravellinSolo101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights. This hotel is actually in Korea town and about 3 or 4 stops from downtown LA. Definitely NOT walking distance. Convenience wise, ie getting from airport or union station, it's right across the road from the metro station which is only $1.25 and quick, frequent and convenient, and also very safe, at all hours. Also, the 720 rapid transit bus to Santa Monica stops right outside (also stops near Rodeo Drive). My room was clean and spacious, but upon pulling back the bedspread, discovered that the blanket had many cigarette burn-holes in it. I asked for the most quiet room as I have trouble sleeping with traffic noise and found many hotels in America don't have good insulation. I was given a room on the 12th floor, but still had to use ear plugs as it was still noisy. I didn't think to ask for a room change, but upon reading the previous review, would definitely do it next time. I'd suggest if you want to stay here, that you ask for a room at the back of the building AWAY from Wilshire Boulevard as this is a major arterial road. Bathroom was clean and staff were polite and helpful, especially the guys at the concierge desk. Although, they didn't even know that LA has a Visotor Information Centre on Figuroa across from the metro station at 7th (which I found by accident). They weren't all that helpful in regards to some questions about getting around LA, but they tried at least. They have a business centre, but you have to pay and arm and a leg for internet access. There is an internet cafe across the road which is good value as well as Carl Juniors, McDonalds, a Coffee Shop, Italian/pizza, Sandwich bar and Japanese restaurant, just to name a few.

Reviews.Title: “Barely passable-good location, price”
Reviews.Author: kc~in~motion
Reviews.Content: The rooms really need upgrading--soiled carpets and bedspreads, who-knows-what sticky stuff on the phone. Clock radio did not work. Outdated fixtures in the bathroom and poor lighting throughout. Put a towel on the seat of the desk chair as it looked sticky too. On the other hand, check-in was friendly and unproblematic and we paid $99/night. In these days of deep cuts in the travel budget, it was passable for a night--close to our meeting. The price is hard to beat in that area of LA. Avoid it if you have more to spend on lodging. Try the Farmer's Daughter.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay â€“ good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jenvj
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m a great believer in speak as you find, I hadnâ€™t checked out any reviews prior to staying at the Wilshire Plaza and upon reading on my return was surprised by the mixed views and therefore felt compelled to leave an account of my own experience. Upon arrival check in was extremely smooth, we were staying on the 8th floor. Got to our room and was pleasantly surprised as it was spacious, bathroom was clean with lots of fresh towels, although a little dated and a refurb wouldnâ€™t go a miss. But for the money we had paid we were happy. Unfortunately I did notice a rather large damp patch near the window in the bedroom which I was rather puzzled about but put this to the back on my mind and we went out for the evening. On retiring for the evening, I happened to notice a strange object which appeared to be on the top cover of my sisterâ€™s bed, on closer inspection we discovered it was actually dried on chewing gum â€“ eek! She removed the top cover and we went to sleep. They say these things come in 3â€™s and our room was on the front of the hotel, which I have to say didnâ€™t disturb my sister but I found it difficult to sleep and decided that I should speak with reception in the morning. The following day at reception we were quickly asked whether we wished to change rooms, we did, we had a new room on the rear of the property on the 4th floor. Whilst re-packing of suitcases in the 8th floor room, Pedro, one of the maintenance engineerâ€™s appeared to look at the mysterious leak, this was probably no more than 10 minutes after we had reported the problem. Once settled into our new room we had no further problems, we were very happy and I had no further problems with traffic noise from outside. Try and request a room at the rear is my advice. We found the staff to be pleasant and polite at all times. Breakfast wasnâ€™t included within our room rate but there was plenty of choice and should you not wish to go for the buffet options there were plenty of cheaper options you could choose from. Great snack bar in the hotel lobby which we quite often bought our lunch from also gift shop which sold crisps, sweets and cold drinks. Check out the great juice bar Robekâ€™s across the road, made solely of fruit and they last for ages, really, really good. Swimming Pool was lovely, good size, it was never full although had it have been there may have been a requirement for more sun loungers. Water always cold though even when the sun had been on it all day but actually it was quite refreshing to cool yourself down and isnâ€™t that the idea of swimming pools?! We didnâ€™t hire a car but had no problem with getting about. As someone else mentions in another review, you have both a metro (Wilshire/Normandie) across the road and a bus stop on either side of the road. The 720 bus takes you all the way to Santa Monica, this takes about Â¾ of an hour, although there is a 920 which we reckon doesnâ€™t stop and so many places along the way and would probably get you there quicker but these are few and fair between. Bus costs you $1.25 single trip. As for the metro, that doesnâ€™t run all the way to Santa Monica but is really useful for getting to Hollywood, again a single trip would cost you $1.25. As for eats, unless you head downtown I agree with other reviewers apart from fast food places didnâ€™t seem to be much around the hotel although this didnâ€™t bother my sister and I, we generally jumped on the metro or headed off down to Santa Monica on the bus for the evening. Would highly recommend â€œTime Out â€“ Los Angelesâ€� as a guide book this gave us lots of tips on places to visit and places to drink/eat etc. Places that you wouldnâ€™t necessarily stumble across. We ate well. This was my first trip to LA although my sister had been once before, we thoroughly enjoyed our 8 day stay at the Wilshire Plaza, we didnâ€™t want to come home and will definitely be visiting LA again and would not hesitate in staying in the Wilshire Plaza again. Good value for money, good base for accessing all of what LA has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: soonersshadow
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband and my 2 sisters stayed in this hotel and it was nothing short of disgusting. There were burn marks in the 'smoke free' bedrooms, a smell of urine, loud trucks keeping us awake at all hours of the night and above all, it was not within walking distance of a decent restaurant or pub. This hotel was recommended by 1800 hotels and described as being 'accessible' and 'within walking distance' from all sorts of activities. It could not have been further from the truth... so don't book this hotel and don't book through 1800 hotels!!! We had to move hotels and 1800 hotels won't refund us the money even though the hotel we stayed in is not charging them!!!! Figure that one out yourselves!!!! Oh yeah - and the in house gym consisted of 3 threadmills on a carpeted room!!! And it cost 20$ to park every night in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT be put off by the negative reviews. Book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EKR2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from the 30th June to 5th July. Having read the reviews we were nervous but I honestly cannot see what people have to complain about for the price you pay. Check in was spot on and "Keith" was very accomodating in getting us a nice room facing the hollywood sign. (the quieter side too). The rooms are big and YES it does need a refurb but its not as bad as everyone has made out. The beds are comfy, nice big window with a good view. They do need washing tho!!! The pool area is great and at this time of year the sun is on it all day long from 0700 til around 8pm. Very hot too! I read on a review in October that the sun wasnt on the pool! what do you expect in October!!!!! The breakfast is really good and very cheap. Buffet for 14 dollars and plenty of choice. Really nice waiters and great service. My negatives are that the restaurant does not open in the evening which is a shame and could do well and the gym equipment is very old and the air con doesnt work in there, but that was good for me!!!! The underground metro is accross the road so easy to get to Hollywood, Santa Monica etc etc and only 5 dollars all day travel. There arent really many restaurants close by walking distance to the hotel. Avoid HMS Bounty as they tried to add 15% to our food bill even tho it said would only add for parties of 5 or more. They did try it on tho! Nice try but we check our bills thoroughly. Tip if you want to do washing: Turn left out of side entrance to the hotel and walk about 4 blocks you will see a 24 hour launderette very cheap and easy to use. I read that people didnt feel safe in the area. We didnt feel this at all but as always wherever you go, you need to be observant at all times. Free internet is fast and really good. The hotel is clean and tidy rooms are cleaned everyday and fresh towels etc etc. Oh and there was no smell of smoke anywhere in the hotel only air fresheners!! Some of the rooms were been steam cleaned. I would happily return anytime. Thankyou for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdeurs
Reviews.Content: My friends and I (from Norway), stayed here for 9 days. Check-in went well, and the staff was charming and polite, as well as serviceminded. The rooms we're just what we expected, since the prize was low. Not large but somewhere inbetween. It was clean and didnt smell like an ashtray, even though it was a smoking-room. The showers needs an upgrade, cause you got to be a proffesor or a rocket scientist to get the right temperature. And the really need to make bigger pizzas, in the restaurant. We ordered a pizza, wich they charged 20$ for. You would expect that you got a big pizza for that price, but it wasnt even food for one person. But hell, Los Angeles got tons of great restaurants, so why complain ? Youre are not supposed to be in the hotel, when youre on vacation. The brakfast is awesome. Really good food, just too bad we were so hangovered, that we missed it a large ammount of times. All in all a very nice hotel, will definetaly stay there again. Wilshire is very central. Just in the middle between Santa Monica and Hollyweed.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you don't expect much”
Reviews.Author: cheggy
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is the best thing about it - it is located on Wilshire blvd, the main street in LA, a rather safe location. Bus stop across the street, as well as metro station. When we asked the taxi driver that drove us to the hotel is this place safe, he said: This street good, one street up and down not good (it's good to know):-) Lobby of the hotel is big and nice (Starbucks coffee) but everything else is desperate for renovation. Carpet looks dirty. Rooms don't look clean at all, everything is worn out and old, especially the blankets. Internet is free of charge but very slow! Good for one or two nights if you can't afford more and if not very picky.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Executive Suite”
Reviews.Author: One2Few
Reviews.Content: I got an automatic upgrade to an executive suite, its a beautiful, big room with free wireless internet and water, also there is a pool open 24 hours

Reviews.Title: “Fair at Best”
Reviews.Author: diamond6Phoenix_AZ_
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights and it was not all that great. I had been at another hotel in hollywood the week before and wished I had stayed there for my entire stay. This hotel at one time was most likely a luxury hotel. Not anymore- It really needs to be remodeled very badly. The carpet in the hallways was worn out and the entire property feels worn. It was built in 1979 and some parts like the curtains in the rooms are original. The front desk person was very nice but the bartender did not say one word when I asked for a bucket of ice .Not all of the floors have Ice machines. Also you must valet park and they charge for parking. The hollywood hotel did not. Until they redo this property, I do not recommend it in its current state.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: Aloha808Hawaii
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical because the photos on hotel websites are not very accurate and this hotel was no exception. The 1st room was nicer than the 2nd room (we had to switch rooms because the a/c wasn't working, but they sent someone over right away to check and switched us when it couldn't be fixed right away. That was fast. The rooms could use upgrading, but then the prices would soar so we're OK with it because we got a great deal, just need to keep checking every now and then. There was one day that our room keys weren't working--both of them so I had to go back down, but they were good about it and sent a security guard to go with us in case the key didn't work. The location is great! We wanted to stay in Koreatown. The parking is only valet,but the attendants (well most of them) were nice. There was one that refused to wipe the bird droppings. When we went to pick up the car (our rental was clean when we dropped it off), the valet attendant went to get it, saw the bird droppings and asked another attendant to clean it up but he didn't! Overall, I'd stay here again if the price was right. Planning our Christmas trip now so we'll see if we can get at least the same rates (or close to it) if we're going to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “In need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: BIGTELL
Reviews.Content: !st visit to Cal, and our choice of this hotel was the biggest mistake we made in our 3 week trip. The hotel was in an area we didn't feel comfortable in particularly after dark. The rooms are very tired and in desperate need of refurbishment. The bar is very poorly stocked, after purchasing 4 bottles of lager the first of our 3 nights here, we were unable to purchase any more (out of stock) The cafe patio area was on the main road and we were constantly pestered by people walking up to us begging cigaretts and asking for money to buy coffee. The staff were very helpful, and the subway was directly opposite the hotel. The hotel is way over priced and will not be recommended by us to other travellers to LA.

Reviews.Title: “The Wilshire Plaza is ok for the price.”
Reviews.Author: LeDash
Reviews.Content: We were frankly a little concerned with choosing this hotel due to the reviews which to be seemed all over the place but it was clear that the main issue was the upkeep of the facility. Frankly we were ok with the hotel. We wanted a place in Korea Town and didn't want to spend a fortune for it and finding a good price through Agoda made it a win/win. Yes this place needs to be upgraded- its decor and furnishings are about 20 years in the past. However our room on the 10th floor facing the Hollywood sign was clean and satisfactory. I didn't cringe in the bathroom. The people at the front desk and the valet were accomodating and pleasant enough. Its possible to find "on street" parking if you are willing to drive around a lot and do some walking- I wasn't, so I just figured the $20 a day (with in and out privileges) in the room price. The area is like a downtown and we noticed a lot of eating places right on Wilshire although we didn't need to try them or the hotel restaurant. Overall we were fine with the facility especially for the price. I would imagine that they are going to try to keep the furnishings as they are for as long as they can get away with it. The fitness area is basically a few treadmills with a TV. p.s.- they had free and strong wi fi.

Reviews.Title: “hotel is old but very clean and friendly and helpful personel”
Reviews.Author: drleo66
Reviews.Content: i ve booked 2 rooms 16 to 22 april 09, streetside and near elevator is noisy but otherside is ok, aircondition was broken but technic repair immediatly and they change our room for our comfort, reception is very helpfull , thank you all. housekeeping is very nice and clean. thanks price is very good. Here is a great location in the middle of Los angeles Location is most important think in LA because LA is bigger than map view . Free wireles internet access is cool. bussines center is cool but not free print for each a4 is 0,5 usd min 3 usd Valet park is 20 usd and dont forget plus tip to vale at check out because they are looking like an italian mafia ::))))

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette005
Reviews.Content: After meeting my son who has been backpacking around the world we travelled to the Wilshire Plaza for our first trip to LA. We caught the Super Shuttle which cost $16USD + tip and arrived at the hotel and checked in. Our room was on the 4th floor and had a nice view, it was clean and comfortable with two double beds. Housekeeping of our room during our stay of 6 nights was great the housekeeper did an amazing job as my son's backpack was not exactly in one spot...We caught the Metro everywhere and the station was across the road, we also caught buses to Santa Monica and the bus stop was outside the Hotel. We had various questions daily for the Concierge Brandon, who was so helpful and polite and managed to book a few things for us, and was a pleasure to have a chat with as we came and went. I decided to extend my stay for a late check out due to the late departure of my flight and this was no problem whatsovever. The coffee shop is managed by a lovely gentleman who makes the best coffee, and serves up delicious looking cakes etc. We found the Hotel to be very quite, and is surrounded by fabulous restaurants for every budget, as well as an Internet cafe across the road.Would definately stay here again, and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach in my room.”
Reviews.Author: lyuo5
Reviews.Content: I came in late to the hotel very tired, but got an okay price for the room. But to my disappointment when I woke up in the morning, and went next to the windows there was a dead cockroach right next to the windows on the ground. It totally disgusted me. I could have even stepped on it. This is totally unacceptable. For the appearance for the hotel, I don't think you'll ever expect anything like this. I would have asked to change my room, but wasn't planning on staying there another night. When I went downstairs to check out from the hotel, the person working at the front desk was apolegietic, but couldn't do anything about it, but give me $20 off and give free valet. He told me to call back and talk to the manager. When I called the manager, he said he would have to check with housekeeping to go upstairs and check it there really was a cockroach in the room. All he said was he'll will get back to me on that. When he called me back, he said he's sorry and again said the same thing the other employee did. He'll give me a $20 discount. I think they are just being really greedy. If there is a cockroach in one of the rooms, I think it is the manager's job to do everything he can do to please the guest or at least satisfy them. The room should have been a complimentary or at least could have given a free room the next time we come. They are not being very professional and wouldn't ever recommend this hotel to a friend or any other travelers who are coming to LA. There are so many other hotels in LA anyone could find than to go to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, excellent location - will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Hut49
Reviews.Content: Right across the street from Wilshire/Normandie Metro and bus stop provides very easy access to Downtown in 10-15 mins. We found this hotel to be far better than expected - very pleasant and helpful front-desk and concierge staff at all times of the day. Nice Starbucks equipped facility in the Lobby with diligent baristas and the bar/food area is nicely presented with good quality flat screen TVs for sports etc. Rooms are excellent size (we were on the 8th floor (#835 and 837) with a view all the way over to the "Hollywood" sign. Free internet access and it's high-speed and reliable too! Very comfortable bed and room cleaning was excellent. Some of the furniture was a little tired, but that is getting just too picky! We found rooms at $77 Manager's Special rate on the Hotels website and snapped these up. Such great value for money. I would stay here again without one second's hesitation. There's a scattering of reasonable restaurants in the vicinity but with Downtown so accessible just jump on the bus

Reviews.Title: “What are some people expecting for this money?”
Reviews.Author: GlodenGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days last Novemeber whilst on holiday with 2 friends. I have to say I was almost dreading it after reading some of the reviews on this site but I was pleasantly surprised. The room we were allocated on arrival was a bit tired & could have done with being redecorated but it was clean. It was at the front of the hotel and we could hear the traffic from the very busy Wiltshire Blvd so we compained at reception and requested a room at the rear and as there were 3 of us sharing, asked whether they had anything larger. The receptionist could not have been more helpful. He had a security guard show us another 4 rooms, including a suite. As the suite was at the front again, we opted for a standard room at the rear which was nice and quiet. As he had been unable to upgrade our room, he gave us free breakfasts for our entire stay. I can definitely recommend the breakfasts. We also had dinner one evening and used the bar. The food was fine and the service was very friendly. The hotel's location is excellent, with a bus stop almost on the doorstep and a metro station across the street (buses highly recommended for cheapness and entertainment value). All in all, I would recommend this hotel as very good value for money. Yes it could do with some refurbishment but the room we stayed in was clean. If you're not happy with the room allocated to you then present yourself at reception and complain.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: canmower
Reviews.Content: I would have camped on the roof for the view we had of Hollywood , the window in our room was large and we were on the 11th floor and kept the curtains wide open most of the time. The city just shimmered at night. The Philippine consulate was a short walk and the Asian dinning in the area was wonderful and I felt safe. The subway just across the street and you can ride to so many places all day for just $ 10. The hotel was old but clean and still had some luster. The heater in our room seemed to have been disconnected and it did get chilly , we had to run the hot water to heat the bathroom. But I liked it it kept my little wife snuggling to me all night.. The wifi was weak and slow and had to get our own transportation from and to LAX , public transportation possable but not reccomended. You get what you pay for It was a good deal for me.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced, Over rated”
Reviews.Author: bheadey
Reviews.Content: Judging from the lobby we were very pleased with the hotel. When we arrived to our room it was instant disappointment, the room was extremely dirty, the windows looked like they had not been cleaned in months, and the floor was filthy. I immediately called the front desk to ask them to clean the windows for us the next morning. To our surprise when we arrived back into the hotel room the next afternoon, the windows and room still remained dirty. The bathroom was also a disappointment, with no plug in the bath, and scum on the tub. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone planning to take a trip to LA. It is a complete waste of money, and you would probably get a better stay at a MOTEL8. Horrible hotel... and the staff was not much better.

Reviews.Title: “Love the pool”
Reviews.Author: bubblez_04
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located in the heart of the korean downtown area. I was happy because the bus was right outside and the Metro was across the street. It is home to some delicious korean and japanese restaurants. The room was clean, heater/ac worked all the time, TV had clear channel. The pool was perfect with lawn chairs to tan and the view of the boulevard. I was dissappointed with the fitness center. Seems like no one takes care of it, 1 eliptical and 2 treadmills...?? Overall i would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Superior value and easy access to downtown”
Reviews.Author: techconfgoer
Reviews.Content: Downtown hotels were all booked up b/c of a massive Msft developer conference that I was attending. $151/nite at the Wilshire Plaza was the best deal I could find. It's in the heart of Koreatown, about 2 miles west of the convention center. But the Wilshire Normandie subway stop is across the street - it's just 3 stops to Staples/downtown for $1.25. The guests were an interesting mix. Korean businessmen seemed to be the largest contingent, but there were tourists and other business-types, too. The hotel decor has a slightly dated feel, but my room was clean and definitely adequate on all counts. Wifi was free. My favorite hotel in downtown LA is still the Miyako in Little Tokyo for both business and pleasure, but I would strongly consider the Wilshire Grand for an alternative if the former was booked.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed!”
Reviews.Author: villamartin
Reviews.Content: My Daughter & I stayed at this Hotel for 8 nights in October. On arriving we had no complaints as the check in was quick & the guy was very friendly & said our requests had been met. We went up to our North side facing room on the 10th floor which had a lovely view of the Hollywood Hills & sign. Although the room was a good size & well laid out the carpet was full of stains which I feel is very off putting.
