We chose this Hotel as we were not hiring a car & there is a metro station across the road. We used public transport the whole time & had no problems what so ever. The Tulips restaurant on the second floor in the Hotel is only open for Breakfast & Lunch, so if you get back after a long day out the best you can do is order food & the bar & they bring it down from somewhere & it is cold. We only made this mistake once. In the area apart fro Denny's two blocks up there is not restaurants at all. All the staff are foreign not American & sometimes we had problems making ourselves understood. Nobody seems very happy working at this Hotel they all walk around with glum faces. The conceirge albeit again far from friendly can be helpful depending which one is on duty. Downside also the swimming pool is on the second floor, so if you get back late afternoon & think you can sit in the sunshine forget it, the Hotel is surrounded by high rise building which totally block out the sun. This was not our main holiday so we got on with it. I would certainly not reccomend this Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: travelh0bby
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is outdated but it is clean. For the price we paid it is ok. still the cheapest hotel in downtown with a really good location. First we thought we were in a bad area but I agree they are in the outskirts of Koreatown but on Wilshire Blvd & to our surprise almost close to everything. We ask the concierge for some maps, we drove Wilshire down going towards the water & we toured the museums on Wilshire, further down it took us to rodeo drive, beverly hills. We continued driving it took us to Westwood village all the way to Santa Monica Beach. On our second nt we took the train & its easy access to get to downtown LA. Overall we were pleased with how easy it was to get around, downtown la hotels parkign is also outrageous & you have to walk (a long walk) to a parking building if you want to self park. Atleast this hotel (yes it is a bit expensive $20 bucks) but every where you go they charge about the same if not higher. We are not much into commuting & using public transportation but it was an added bonus that the train station is right adjacetn to the hotel. Saved us from all the LA traffic. I recommend this hotel to every one, well except for honey mooners. But if you want to save money & have an easy trip to manuever around LA, then I think this is a good choice hotel to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough; friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Adam1222
Reviews.Content: After getting a very cheap deal on priceline for this hotel, I was a little nervous from the reviews on here. Overall, though, it was a totally better-than-fine hotel. The facilities were clean, the room was big. Valet parking was quick and not too expensive ($20/night). The lobby/restaurant area was very nice, and the location is very convenient . Staff was extraordinarily friendly and helpful- helped me with a fax for free. That being said, this hotel used to be the Radisson and is showing some wear and tear that that chain would likely not have allowed. Small tears in carpet and wallpaper, etc. But cleaner than many chains I'd stayed in. Don't think it's worth the rack-rate, but for priceline or a good deal, perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: “The Elegant Pictures are Deceiving!”
Reviews.Author: Jospill
Reviews.Content: The elegant pictures make the Wilshire Plaza look much nicer than it really is. My first experience with this hotel was when I was struggling up from the parking garage with a very heavy suitcase; the bellboy helped a much younger colleague with her bags, and the valet just stood there and looked at me. The staff was young and not particularly friendly or helpful, save for the concierge who directed us to a great restaurant for dinner. The carpets in the hallways and rooms were dingy and spotted. The floors were worn and scuffed.The door hinges in the bathroom were rusty and there was a hole in the wall. The fan in the bathroom did not work, either. The furnishings in my room were cheap and somewhat worn. The noise from the traffic on Wilshire Boulevard was constant, even at 2:00 in the morning; I barely slept while I was there. The neighborhood was sketchy, even scary. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “WE recommend the Wilshire Plaza Hotel”
Reviews.Author: irish65
Reviews.Content: WE had a wonderful expernience at the Wilshire Plaza. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the employees were more than helpful. The food in their restaurant was very good. The hotel is convenient to all public transportation and there is also parking on site We hightly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the LA area as the price is right and it is convenient to all.

Reviews.Title: “I had a Great stay...An Honest review”
Reviews.Author: sweetieali143
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Los Angeles this morning. This was my first trip to California, and I have been wanting to visit since I was 10 years old. Prior to leaving I read reviews for Wilshire Plaza hotel, and some of them were bad, some were good, and some were just downright disgusting. But the rate was great, and I decided to give them the benefit of the doubt and give the hotel a try. I have to say that my boyfriend and I were pleasantly surprised! The hotel DID look like the pictures on expedia, and the staff was very friendly. We even thought that our air conditioner was broken, but it turned out that we did not turn the knob right, but they sent a repairman up with in 10 minutes of us telling them our problem. The room was very nice, and we had a great view. The pool area was very pretty with terraces with flowers on them, but we did not end up swimming because we went to the beach instead. The hallways were clean and smelt fresh, and not like fish and smoke as someone had remarked in a review. We requested a non-smoking room, and we received one. I did not smell ANY smoke throughout the building, not even outside. When we checked in we were even given the choice of which side of the hotel we would like to stay on, either street view, or at the back which was quiet, but not a good view. We chose the street. The area was very nice. On out first night we walked several blocks to Denny's and felt safe. It was quiet and there were only a few people walking around. There were not rats or homeless people laying around that I saw, as someone posted in their review, and yes it is in the middle of "Korea town", but It was still a nice area. If you want to see homeless people check out Hollywood blvd. All in all, I had a fantastic time at this hotel, No it was not 5 star, it was not brand new with plasma screen tvs or any other things like that, but it was a nice older hotel with a lot of character. The only complaint we had was the parking. The first night we did not do valet, because we found somewhere to park on the street. The receptionist even told us where we could park on the street, but your car would have to be moved by 8am. So yes it was possible to avoid the $20 a day valet parking, but we did not want to get up at 7:30am every morning to move the car, so we gave in and did valet, which was very nice and convenient. No worries of tickets or damage. If you are going to Los Angeles, you will find that parking, especially downtown is VERY sparse and hard to find, not to mention expensive. So this is not really a problem of the hotel. If anyone is looking to stay at this hotel and wants more details or has questions feel free to e-mail me at Swe----al----@hotmail.com. And I will give you an honest, not Bitter review.

Reviews.Title: “Thee absolute WORST I've ever stayed...”
Reviews.Author: IMnobody621
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip through Expedia, and although the reviews weren't the greatest I decided to give it a try. I'm a very easy going person and don't expect much, so I went into this experience with a positive attitude and hoped for the best... I'm not going to sit here and write a "vengeful" or "exaggerated" review, I am just simply stating the facts... which I have pictures AND video to support. The first room I recieved had several things wrong... there were absolutely NO towels, the phone did not work and the air conditioning was completely broken. I have a picture of the thermostat set at 60 degress (top setting), but the setting on the bottom which is the actual room temperature was maxed out at 75-80! We could not sleep as we stayed up all night tossing and turning covered in sweat! I had to walk to the front desk to ask for a room change due to the phone being broken, I was polite but shared my unhappiness with the front desk. I should've known this would be an ongoing problem when I first arrived to complain at the front desk, there was a lady in front of me SCREAMING because her a/c did not work, her roof was leaking and the television did not work. There was also a man behind her that said his roof was also leaking and his a/c also did not work. I was given a room change and 2 comp tickets to the next morning's breakfast buffet. The second room was worse than the first. The a/c also did not work, the ceiling leaked, the phone did not work, the bathroom was infested with mold, there were BULLET HOLES in the window and BLOOD STAINS on the curtains! I again had to walk to the front desk because the phone did not work, and was infuriated when I found the elevators to be out of service! I had to take the STAIRS for SEVEN FLOORS! The manager seemed annoyed and said there's nothing he can do for me... he said it's an "old building" and that he had FIFTEEN room changes the night before! He offered me nothing except an attitude and ended the conversation by saying I can pack up and leave if I want and he'd refund the last night! Ontop of that they called that night to ask me to come down and pay the 20 dollar PER NIGHT fee for valet parking... which I absolutley refused to pay. I reset the trip odometer on my rental car and found my suspisions to be true... the mileage went up, gas went down, and I found reciepts for Burger King and Staples stuffed down on the side of my seat for that current day! Of course this was denied up and down and I had to walk away or I would probably be in La County Jail right now. The breakfast buffet was pathetic... free for us with out comp tickets, but it's regularly $13.50! It had average (at best) french toast, watery eggs, bacon, orange juice, and cereal with warm milk. Please do NOT stay at this hotel, I felt bad for every single person walking in the doors while I was there. Feel free to contact me through here or use my screename at yahoo dot com for more information... the videos I cannot post due to there being some profanity, but I'd be willing to email them. The pictures I have posted on here and are all 100% real! An absolute dump, I thought I was in the vortex of hell...

Reviews.Title: “Its Not as Bad as it seems Many Improvements”
Reviews.Author: joebruin19
Reviews.Content: The reviews are horrible but we needed a place to stay near the Wiltern so it we decided to take a chance. Come to find out the hotel has done a total revamp of management and it shows. Service was OK valet was pricey but wokrek for us. The only problem was no room service in the evening. Staff was pleasant and the rate was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to stay”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker056
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and we found the location to be fine, easy for getting around to all the main attractions we travelled safely on the Metro Bus and train in the 3 days we had there, the Hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful, the rooms where clean and tidy, because we had been on a tour of the states we found this hotel very reasonably priced, Sue 56yrs Tom 63yrs from Manchester England.

Reviews.Title: “Why are you feeling so vengeful?”
Reviews.Author: AroundtheWorld50
Reviews.Content: We wanted an inexpensive hotel in LA since we had blown our budget on Disney Hall tickets. We booked through Priceline and were horrified when we read what TripAdvisors reviews had to say about our "assigned" hotel. We were determined to go there in a positive mood, and the place definitely surpassed our expectations. We were nice to personnel and they were very pleasant back. Yes, parking is expensive ($20), but we had no trouble finding a place on the street. Things were clean and perfectly adequate. I sometimes think that when one goes somewhere with the expectation of disaster, it is a self-fulfilling event. Go there, be pleasant, and you will find that you got a very good deal in an expensive hotel city.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TerinaSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wilshire Plaza for a few nights with friends and it was unbelievably bad. All the sheets on our beds were too short and stopped about a foot from the end of the bed leaving just bare mattress or scratchy blanket, my sheets also had holes in them. I mentioned it to the desk and got a blank look and no improvement the next night. The concierge desk didn't seem to have ever dealt with guests before, they had little to no knowledge of the area and we had to push to be given any information. Most questions were met with confused looks, I'm not sure if many people at the desk understood English well as I never got much of a response. We called for room service and were told that despite all advertisements and signs, they didn't have it that night. Also, this was a terrible place to stay as a tourist, it is nowhere near any of the tourist destinations listed on the website, it cost us $15-20 in a taxi to get to Hollywood, Melrose, or Sunset. If you value the time you have in LA, please avoid this place!

Reviews.Title: “Ripped Off”
Reviews.Author: Storagedude
Reviews.Content: We recently booked a trip through Hotels.com at the Wilshire hotel. It was my wife's B-day so I took her to L.A. to the Price is Right show. We arrived in L.A. at 11:30pm and were met by the Valet at our car door. After unloading our car we were escorted to our rooms by a bell hop who entered the room before us and unloaded all our things and left. When we entered the room we found out why he was in such a hurry. The bathroom had mold on the caulking all the way around the tub. The carpet was vacuumed from the door to the bed and everything outside of that had about a quarter of an inch of lint and dust on it. The bed shams were torn and the sheets and blankets were nasty. We slept in our cloths!!!! Actually we didn't sleep much because we could hear our neighbors doing the wild thing for about an hour. I asked for a wake for 5:00am and was late because they didn't call until 6:00am. When we went down to the lobby we asked for a map quest to get to CBS and the desk clerk said you don't need one just follow the the crowd and you will get there. My wife actually had to tell him "now you be a good little boy and go over there and get me a map quest honey" then he finally did it. Thank god because it was about 10 turns and 12 miles from the hotel we would have never found it. So we went to get our car and the valet said you need $20.00 to get your car back. I asked him why and he showed me a sign about 9"x9" hidden behind a podium that read if you only stay for 1 night you have to pay $20.00 to park. Then we knew why the valet had met us at our car so that we had no chance at all to read the stupid sign. When we returned from the studio we had to argue with the valet to be able to park again without having to pay again. All and all our stay at the WILSHIRE HOTEL was one of the worst experiences of my life and left us with a very bad taste in our mouths for HOTELS.COM. SO BEWARE

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: J0hnF
Reviews.Content: Ok stay, not the best looking hotel out there but the staff is friendly and efficient. The Breakfast buffet is way above average although it's not cheap. The parking is expensive ($20/night).

Reviews.Title: “Worst Korean Owned Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KoreanTraveler
Reviews.Content: DON"T EVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL. All they care about is their Korean wedding receptions on the weekends. They can care less about their guests. They first tell us that their are no king beds and then we find out from another guest reception person their are tons of king bed rooms available. The rooms are old and noisy due to the high traffic on whilshire blvd. The furnishings are old and we found stains all over the carpet. We asked for compensation and they agreed to cut 20 dollars off our rate. We were not completely satisfied with the compensation but what can we do. At the time of check out, they renegged on their compensation asked for full payment. I don't recommend this hotel to anyone. I'm so upset. This place screwed my whole weekend. I'm Korean as well, and they can care less. This hotel wants to gouge every guest because they know that they won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “terrible.”
Reviews.Author: FruitBubbles
Reviews.Content: When I first stayed here 4 years ago (when it was still the Radisson), I was pretty happy with my stay. I came back recently (now it's the Wilshire Plaza) because my company booked me a room here for a business venture. I've stayed in 2 star hotels that were better than this place. Out of all the problems, the labor strike and the closed pool were the least of my worries. We arrived at 2pm and the concierge stated that our rooms might not even be ready by 3pm. They lost our reservation forms and we wouldn't have gotten our rooms if we didn't have a copy on hand. The call taxi service that they advertise downstairs wouldn't even bother to come pick us up on 2 occasions, and I was left stranded 3 miles away with no familiarity of the area (i was lucky to catch a bell cab). The wireless internet downstairs was always a gamble and there was absolutely no internet service in my room over the course of my 4 day stay. If you have a room beyond the 10th floor, DO NOT take the middle elevator. It always stops on the 10th floor even if you don't push the button. On top of that, it will sit there for 5 minutes even if you hold down the close door button. The workout room is small and can really only service 2 people (prepare for a long wait if you see more than 2 people in there). The complimentary fruit and muffin breakfast on the 11th floor is okay, but the fruit tasted like the buyer didn't know how to tell if it was ripe or in season. The hotel has some pros--cleaning service is on point and rooms appeared clean and fresh every time we returned to our rooms. The concierge downstairs seem to cater to guests well. It's located in Koreatown, possibly one of LA's largest drinking and nightlife grounds outside of Hollywood. It's close to a chain of convenient banks, a 24/7 internet cafe (thank God), a really great Korean restaurant next door, and the Normandie/Wilshire Metro stop right across the street. But if you're highly dependent on the very basics like internet and actual working elevators, stay elsewhere. I personally would avoid staying here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “New owners - staff in dispute”
Reviews.Author: Pankent
Reviews.Content: This hotel is no longer a RADISSON. Apparently a new Korean owner took over the hotel in January and there is now a long running labour dispute with the staff. The restaurants are not open, the swimming pool is closed. Fortunately, the staff were able to provide good bar meals for the two eveinigs that we stayed. However, the final straw was a picket line with chanting from 6am until 8 am on our third day. We checked out early without any problems. The hotel is not in a great area, although it is convenient for the Metro. On speaking to staff, we were told that it might be dangerous to venture out at night. The hotel is convenient for downtown, but not for the Rodeo Drive area of Beverly Hills, that is a $35 cab ride away. The hotel is shabby inside, and it is apparent that the new owner has not spent any money in improving amenities since he took it over. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: popkid
Reviews.Content: This hotel was OK, nothing great but nothing crap either, we had 2 double beds in our room, rooms were cleaned every day. To be honest we didnt spend that much time in the hotel as we were always out and about, its location is alright would've preffered to have been a bit nearer Beverley Hills and Santa Monica but was still only a bus ride away, bus stop is right outside hotel door! If I went again I would stay in a different hotel only because of the location. If you're looking for a nice clean hotel then this is perfect and seemed reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Sucked big time”
Reviews.Author: charleen2007
Reviews.Content: Their site suggests that they are located near Beverly Hills. In fact, they are a 30-minute drive down Wilshire Boulevard from Beverly Hills. Check-in took about 20 minutes. Looked like the front desk clerk was writing the Great American Novel on his computer the entire time. Because it took so long, he "upgraded" us to business class rooms ("not really much better," he said) on the 10th floor. Only one elevator's card reader was working, so the other two could not be used to reach that floor. One had to wait until the only working elevator decided to appear. Took about 5 minutes of watching the other elevators come and go. We had reserved three rooms. They were just okay. However, none of them had working, or complete coffee makers. Ours was missing the carafe and filter basket. A call to the front desk brought a fellow bearing coffee. I explained that I had coffee, but needed a carafe and basket. He returned with a carafe. I still needed the basket. He came back again with two baskets, neither of which fit, and no carafe. I told him to forget it and went to bed. He returned again with a replacement coffee makers. Which had the wrong-size carafe, meaning that unless I had modified the basket, it would not ever ever drip coffee into the carafe. At least he tried. Meanwhile, in the other room, our kids needed extra blankets. They called housekeeping twice, and blankets never arrived. They went to the front desk to request blankets. They tried to return to their rooms using the elevator, but since it was feeling petulant and didn't want to come, they tried the stairwell, but were locked out of the elite 10th floor, so had to catch the third elevator on another floor in order to get back to their rooms. The blankets never arrived. The grout in the bathrooms needed cleaning. Otherwise, the front desk staff were friendly though overworked. Would we go back again? No. Not at that price, especially not if they offered to upgrade us to the infamous 10th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: LAtravelerKentucky
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel prior to reading other reviews and arrived somewhat unsure of what we would find. The valet attendant, front desk clerk and everyone we encountered at the Wilshire Plaza were friendly and efficient. Housekeeping responded immediately to a heating issue (coldest days in LA) and our car was delivered promptly. The room was clean when we arrived and was maintained well during our four day stay. The folks working the "coffee bar" were efficient and gave good information. The location of the hotel was perfect for our sightseeing to Long Beach, Santa Monica, Hollywood and the Taper Theater. We were very pleased with the room, food service and employees. VERY good value for our money. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Not Radisson anymore...”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler-SWE
Reviews.Content: This is no longer a Radisson hotel... The new staff is impolite. The rooms was OK The subway is just outside the entrance. The breakfast in the restaurant is a joke and the staff there is also impolite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. No problems.”
Reviews.Author: Ricardfred
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here along with a large tour group. Despite other posts having a negative experience we all liked this hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful. My room, although bland, was clean and had everything I needed. The air con was perfect. Despite facing the street the room was quiet and I slept very well. The great advantage of this hotel is that it is just accross the street from the metro and we were able to get to Universal Studios, Hollywood, etc without any hassle or expense. There is also a bus stop outside door with buses every few minutes down to Santa Monica beach. The area is quiet and safe. There is a nice coffee shop in lobby and you can sit outside which we enjoyed. There is also a small gift shop and gym. The pool is nice too but small. I stayed in many budget hotels in the US and this really was one of my favourites. Its not luxury but I found it clean, friendly and in a great location. I would definitely stay here again.
